They told the Pharaoh, "We have brought miracles from Our Creator. Peace be with those who follow the right guidance.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So go you both to him and say: Surely we are two apostles of your Lord; therefore send the children of Israel with us and do not torment them! Indeed we have brought to you a communication from your Lord, and peace is on him who follows the guidance;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Go to him and say, 'We are both messengers from your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not oppress them. We have brought you a Sign from your Lord, and may peace be upon whoever follows the right guidance;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "So go ye both to him, and say, 'Verily we are messengers sent by thy Lord: Send forth, therefore, the Children of Israel with us, and afflict them not: with a Sign, indeed, have we come from thy Lord! and peace to all who follow guidance!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We sent Moses with miracles after (these apostles) to the Pharaoh and his nobles, but they behaved with them high-handedly. See then the end of the authors of evil.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We sent, after them, Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, but they did them wrong; so behold thou, how was the end of the workers of corruption!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We sent, after them, Musa with Our signs unto Fir'awn and his chiefs, but they wronged them. Behold that wise was the end of the corrupters!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then after them We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Signs to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, but they wrongfully rejected them. So see how was the end of the Mufsidun (mischief-makers, corrupts, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then, after them, We sent Moses with Our miracles to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they denounced them. So consider the end of the evildoers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: After those We sent forth Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles, but they dealt with Our signs unjustly. Observe, then, what happened to the mischief-makers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then after them We sent Musa with Our signs to Fir`awn and his chiefs, but they wrongfully rejected them. So see how was the end of the mischief-makers

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then, after them, We sent Moses with our tokens unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they repelled them. Now, see the nature of the consequence for the corrupters!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite, but they wronged them. So observe how was the fate of the agents of corruption!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: After those We sent forth Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his assembly, but with it they harmed. Look at the end of the corrupters.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: After the time of those people, We sent Moses with Our miracles to Pharaoh and his people, but they too rejected Our miracles. Consider, how terrible the end of the evil-doers is!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then we raised after them Musa with Our communications to Firon and his chiefs, but they disbelieved in them; consider then what was the end of the mischief makers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: After them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs. But they willfully rejected them. Consider the end of the evil-doers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they wrongfully rejected them: So see what was the end of those who made mischief.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "O Pharaoh, I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds;

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Moses said, 'Pharaoh, I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Musa said: O Fir'awn! I am an apostle from the Lord of the worlds;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Musa (Moses) said: "O Fir'aun (Pharaoh)! I am a Messenger from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Moses said: 'O Pharaoh! I am a Messenger from the Lord of the universe.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Musa said: "O Fir`awn! Verily, I am a Messenger from the Lord of all that exists."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said: O Pharaoh! Lo! I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Moses said, ‘O Pharaoh, I am indeed an apostle from the Lord of all the worlds.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said: 'Pharaoh, I am a Messenger from the Lord of the Worlds,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses told the Pharaoh, "I am a Messengers from the Lord of the Universe.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Musa said: O Firon! surely I am an apostle from the Lord of the worlds:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the Universe,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "O Pharaoh! I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "I am duty bound to speak nothing of God but the truth I have brought from your Lord a clear sign; so let the people of Israel depart with me."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: worthy to say nothing regarding God except the truth. I have brought a clear sign to you from your Lord; so send forth with me the Children of Israel.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Incumbent it is upon me that I speak naught respecting Allah save the truth; surely I have brought you an evidence from your Lord; wherefore let then go with me the Children of Isra'il.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Proper it is for me that I say nothing concerning Allah but the truth. Indeed I have come unto you from your Lord with a clear proof. So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “It is only proper that I should not say about God anything other than the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with me.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And it behoves me to say nothing about Allah except what is true. I have come to you with a clear sign of having been sent from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Proper it is for me that I say nothing concerning Allah but the truth. Indeed I have come unto you from your Lord with a clear proof. So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Approved upon condition that I speak concerning Allah nothing but the truth. I come unto you (lords of Egypt) with a clear proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: It behooves me to say nothing about Allah except the truth. I certainly bring you a manifest proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: incumbent upon me is that I say nothing of Allah except the truth. I bring you a clear proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel depart with me'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: I must only speak what is true about God. I have brought you miracles from your Lord; therefore, let the children of Israel go free".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (I am) worthy of not saying anything about Allah except the truth: I have come to you indeed with clear proof from your Lord, therefore send with me the children of Israel

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: duty-bound to say nothing about God but the truth, and I have brought you a clear sign from your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with me."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: One for whom it is right to say nothing but truth about Allah. Now have I come unto you (people), from your Lord, with a clear (Sign): So let the Children of Israel depart along with me."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "If you have brought a sign then display it, if what you say is true."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'If thou hast brought a sign, produce it, if thou speakest truly.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: if thou hast brought a sign, forth with it then, if thou art of the truth-tellers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "If you have come with a sign, show it forth, - if you are one of those who tell the truth."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “If you brought a miracle, then present it, if you are truthful.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: if you have brought a sign, then bring it forth if you are truthful.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Fir`awn] said: "If you have come with a sign, show it forth, if you are one of those who tell the truth."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: If thou comest with a token, then produce it, if thou art of those who speak the truth.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘If you have brought a sign, produce it, should you be truthful.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He answered: 'If you have come with a sign, show it to us if you are of the truthful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked Moses to show his miracles if he was telling the truth.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: If you have come with a sign, then bring it, if you are of the truthful ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "If you come with a sign, then produce it, if you are telling the truth."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "If indeed thou hast come with a Sign, show it forth,- if thou tellest the truth."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: At this Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it became a live serpent.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So he cast his staff; and behold, it was a serpent manifest.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Thereupon he cast down his rod, when, lo it was a serpent manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then [Musa (Moses)] threw his stick and behold! it was a serpent, manifest!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So he threw his staff, and it was an apparent serpent.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon Moses threw his rod, and suddenly it was a veritable serpent.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then [Musa] threw his staff and behold! it was a [Thu`ban] serpent, manifest!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he flung down his staff and lo! it was a serpent manifest;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it became a manifest python.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He threw down his staff, and it was clearly a serpent.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: So Moses threw down his staff and suddenly it turned into a real serpent.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he threw his rod, then lo! it was a clear serpent.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then Moses threw down his staff and suddenly, unmistakably, it appeared as a serpent,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then (Moses) threw his rod, and behold! it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So he cast his staff, and behold, it was a serpent manifest.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he cast down his staff, and lo! it was a serpent manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So [Musa (Moses)] threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So he cast his staff; and it was a serpent, plain to see.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (No sooner had he said this than) Moses threw down his rod and behold, it was a veritable serpent,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So he threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it was a manifest python.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He cast down his staff and thereupon it was a clear serpent.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses threw his staff and suddenly it became a serpent.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he cast down his rod, and lo! it was an obvious serpent,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So Moses threw down his staff and suddenly it appeared as a serpent, plainly visible.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He asked: "Who then is that Lord of yours, O Moses?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'Who is your Lord, Moses?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: who is the Lord of you twain, O Musa!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Who then, O Musa (Moses), is the Lord of you two?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Who is your Lord, O Moses.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said:" Moses! Who is the Lord of the two of you?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Fir`awn said: "Who then, O Musa, is the Lord of you two"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Who then is the Lord of you twain, O Moses?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Who is your Lord, Moses?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) said: 'Moses, who is the Lord of you both'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked them, "Who is your Lord?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (Firon) said: And who is your Lord, O Musa?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Who then is the Lord of you both, Moses?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (When this message was delivered), (Pharaoh) said: "Who, then, O Moses, is the Lord of you two?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Our Lord is He who gave everything its natural form and directed it."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Our Lord is He who gave everything its creation, then guided it.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: our Lord is He who vouchsafed unto everything its creation, then guided it.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each thing its form and nature, then guided it aright."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Our Lord is He who gave everything its existence, then guided it.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave everything its form and then guided it."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Musa] said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each thing its form and nature, then guided it aright."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Our Lord is He Who gave unto everything its nature, then guided it aright.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Our Lord is He who gave everything its creation and then guided it.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Our Lord' he replied, 'is He Who gave everything its creation and then guided it'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They replied, "Our Lord is the One Who has created all things and has given guidance".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Our Lord is He Who gave to everything its creation, then guided it (to its goal).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "Our Lord is He who has given everything its form, then guided it."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its form and nature, and further, gave (it) guidance."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "And what about the former generations?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'And what of the former generations?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: then what happened to the former generations?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "What about the generations of old?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “What about the first generations?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh asked: "Then, what is the state of the former generations?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Fir`awn] said: "What about the generations of old"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: What then is the state of the generations of old?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘What about the former generations?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) asked: 'How was it then, with the former generations'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He then asked, "What do you know about the past generations?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Then what is the state of the former generations?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh asked, "What about the previous generations?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous generations?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) replied: "Knowledge of that is with my Lord (recorded) in the Book. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said Moses, 'The knowledge of them is with my Lord, in a Book; my Lord goes not astray, nor forgets --

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: the knowledge there of is with my Lord in the Book; my Lord erreth not, nor He forgetteth.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord is neither unaware nor He forgets, "

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Book. My Lord never errs, nor does He forget.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Its knowledge is with my Lord, recorded in the Book. My Lord does not err, nor does He forget."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Musa] said: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither erreth nor forgetteth,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Their knowledge is with my Lord, in a Book. My Lord neither makes any error nor forgets.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Moses) answered: 'The knowledge of them is in a Book with My Lord. My Lord neither goes astray, nor forgets.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses replied, "The knowledge about it is with my Lord in the Book. My Lord is free from error and forgetfulness.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a book, my Lord errs not, nor does He forget;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "My Lord alone has knowledge of that, recorded in a Book. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord, duly recorded: my Lord never errs, nor forgets,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'And what is the Lord of all Being?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said. and what is the Lord of the worlds?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh said, “And what is the Lord of the Worlds?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Fir`awn said: "And what is the Lord of Al-`Alamin"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘And what is ‘‘the Lord of all the worlds?’’ ’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh said: 'And what is the Lord of the Worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh asked, "Who is the Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Firon said: And what is the Lord of the worlds?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "What is this: Lord of the Universe?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "And what is the 'Lord and Cherisher of the worlds'?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'The Lord of the heavens and earth, and what between them is, if you have faith.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is in-between, if ye seek to be convinced.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, if you are aware.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses answered: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you were only to believe."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye had but sure belief.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them,—should you have conviction.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'He' (Moses) replied: 'is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you believe'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses replied, "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if you want to be certain".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you would be sure.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if only you would be convinced."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he to those about him, 'Do you not hear?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said unto those around him: hear ye not?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Do you not hear (what he says)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said to those around him, “Do you not hear?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear (what he says)?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Fir`awn) said to those around: "Do you not hear (what he says)"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said to those who were around him, ‘Don’t you hear?!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Do you not hear' said he (Pharaoh) to those around him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said to the people around him, "Did you hear that?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (Firon) said to those around him: Do you not hear?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said to those around him, "Did you hear?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of old.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "(He is) Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of yore."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said, 'Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses continued, "He is the Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of old.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses went on, "He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'Surely your Messenger who was sent to you is possessed!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said: verily your apostle who hath been sent unto you is mad.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “This messenger of yours, who is sent to you, is crazy.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Fir`awn) said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Indeed your messenger, who has been sent to you, is surely crazy!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: 'Surely, the Messenger who has been sent to you is mad!'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "The Messengers who has been sent to you is certainly insane".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said he: Most surely your Apostle who is sent to you is mad.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "This messenger who has been sent to you is surely possessed!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'The Lord of the East and West, and what between them is, if you have understanding,'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: Lord of the east and the west and whatsoever is in-between, if ye understand.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Lord of the East and the West, and everything between them, if you understand.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses continued: "(He is) the Lord of the east and the west, and all between them. If you only had any understanding!"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Lord of the East and the West and all that is between them, if ye did but understand.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘The Lord of the east and the west and whatever is between them—should you exercise your reason.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'He is the Lord of the East and the West' said he (Moses), 'and all that is between them, if you could understand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses continued, "He is the Lord of the East and West and all that is between them, if only you would think".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: The Lord of the east and the west and what is between them, if you understand.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "He is the Lord of the East and the West, and all that lies between them, if only you could understand."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'If thou takest a god other than me, I shall surely make thee one of the imprisoned.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said: if thou wilt take a god other than me, I shall surely place thee among the prisoners.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "If you choose an ilah (god) other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “If you accept any god other than me, I will make you a prisoner.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "If you choose a god other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly shall place thee among the prisoners.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘If you take up any god other than me, I will surely make you a prisoner!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'If you take any other god except myself' he (Pharaoh) replied, 'you shall be thrown into prison'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "If you put forward any god other than me, I will surely put you in prison".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said he: If you will take a god besides me, I will most certainly make you one of the imprisoned.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "If you take any deity other than myself, I will throw you into prison,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'What, even though I brought thee something so manifest?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: even though I bring unto thee something manifest?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Even if I bring you something manifest (and convincing)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “What if I bring you something convincing?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Even if I were to bring a Clear Sign to you?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Even if I bring you something manifest"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Even though I show thee something plain?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘What if I bring you something [as an] unmistakable [proof]?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'What, even if I brought you something clear' said he (Moses).

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses asked, "What if I were to bring you clear proof (of the existence of God)?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: What! even if I bring to you something manifest?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and Moses asked, "Even if I show you a clear sign?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'Bring it then, if thou art of the truthful.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said: forth with it then, if thou art of the truth- tellers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Bring it, if you are being truthful.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "Then bring it if you are truthful at all."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Then bring it, should you be truthful.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) replied: 'Show us your sign, if you are of the truthful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh replied, "Bring it, if you are telling the truth."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said he: Bring it then, if you are of the truthful ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Show it then, if you are telling the truth!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs to the Pharaoh and his nobles. He said: "I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, and he said, 'Surely, I am the Messenger of the Lord of all Being.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Musa with Our signs Unto Fir'awn and his chiefs, and he said: verily I am an apostle of the Lord of the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We did send Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs (inviting them to Allah's Religion of Islam) He said: "Verily, I am a Messenger of the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our revelations to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. He said, “I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We sent Moses with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. He told them: “I am a Messenger of the Lord of the Universe.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We did send Musa with Our Ayat to Fir`awn and his chiefs. He said: "Verily, I am a Messenger of the Lord of all that exists."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite. He said, ‘I am indeed an apostle of the Lord of all the worlds.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, and he said: 'I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And certainly did We send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, "Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Moses to the Pharaoh and his nobles with Our miracles and he said, "I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Universe".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Musa with Our communications to Firon and his chiefs, so he said: Surely I am the apostle of the Lord of the worlds.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. He said, "I am the messenger of the Lord of the Universe,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And the Pharaoh said to his people: "O people, is not mine the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers that flow at my feet? Can you still not comprehend?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And said Firaun, “O my people! Is not the kingdom of Egypt for me, and these rivers that flow beneath me? So do you not see?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people: 'O my people, do I not possess the kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flowing beneath me? What, do you not see?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Fir'awn proclaimed among his people, saying: O my people! is not mine the dominion of Mis and witness yonder rivers flowing underneath me? See ye not?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Is not mine the dominion of Egypt, and these rivers flowing underneath me. See you not then?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying, “O my people, do I not own the Kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flow beneath me? Do you not see?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people: “My people, do I not have dominion over Egypt, and are these streams not flowing beneath me? Can't you see?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Fir`awn proclaimed among his people (saying): "O my people! Is not mine the dominion of Egypt, and these rivers flowing underneath me. See you not then"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people saying: O my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me? Can ye not then discern?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed to his people, saying, ‘O my people! Do not the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers that run at my feet belong to me? Do you not perceive?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then Pharaoh made a proclamation to his people: 'My people, is the kingdom of Egypt not mine and these rivers which flow beneath me? What, can you not see?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh shouted to his people, "My people, is the kingdom of Egypt not mine? and can you not see that the streams flow from beneath my palace?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon proclaimed amongst his people: O my people! is not the kingdom of Egypt mine? And these rivers flow beneath me; do you not then see?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh called to his people, "My people, is the Kingdom of Egypt not mine? And these rivers that flow at my feet, are they not mine? Do you not see?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me, (witness) these streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Am I (not) better than him who is contemptible, and cannot even express himself clearly?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Or am I better than this man, who is contemptible and scarcely makes things clear?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Aye! I am better than this one who is depicable, and well- nigh cannot make himself plain.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Am I not better than this one [Musa (Moses)], who is Mahin [has no honour nor any respect, and is weak and despicable] and can scarcely express himself clearly?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Am I not better than this miserable wretch, who can barely express himself?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Am I better or this contemptible man who is scarcely able to express himself?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Am I not better than this one (Musa) who is despicable and can scarcely express himself clearly"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable and can hardly make (his meaning) plain!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Am I not better than this wretch who cannot even speak clearly?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Am I not better than this contemptible (man), who can scarcely make things clear (because of the impediment of his speech)?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Or am I [not] better than this one who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Am I not better than this lowly man who can barely express himself?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Nay! I am better than this fellow, who is contemptible, and who can hardly speak distinctly:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Am I not better than this contemptible man who can hardly make his meaning clear:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Am I not better than this (Moses), who is a contemptible wretch and can scarcely express himself clearly?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So We showed Pharaoh all Our signs, but he cried lies, and refused.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We shewed him Our signs, all of them, but he belied and refused.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We showed him [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] all Our Signs and Evidences, but he denied and refused.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We showed him Our signs, all of them, but he denied and refused.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We showed Pharaoh Our Signs, all of them, but he declared them to be false and rejected them.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We showed him (Fir`awn) all Our Ayat, but he denied and refused.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily did show him all Our tokens, but he denied them and refused.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We showed him all Our signs. But he denied [them] and refused [to believe them].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So We showed him (Pharaoh) Our signs, all of them, but he belied and refused them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We showed the Pharaoh all of Our miracles, but he called them lies and turned away from them.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And truly We showed him Our signs, all of them, but he rejected and refused.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We showed Pharaoh all Our signs but he rejected them and refused to believe in them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs, but he did reject and refuse.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And said: "Have you come to us, O Moses, to drive us out of our land with your witchery?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Hast thou come, Moses,' he said, 'to expel us out of our land

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: art thou come unto us that thou mayest drive us out of our land by thy magic, O Musa!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Musa (Moses)?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Did you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He said: "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land by your sorcery?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (Fir`awn) said: "Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Musa"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Hast come to drive us out from our land by thy magic, O Moses?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Moses, have you come to us to expel us from our land with your magic?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He said: 'Moses, have you come to drive us from our land with your sorcery?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said to Moses, "Have you come to expel us from our land through your magic?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said he: Have you come to us that you should turn us out of our land by your magic, O Musa?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said, "Have you come to us to turn us out of our land by means of your magic, Moses?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy magic, O Moses?

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs they said: "This is nothing but magic he has contrived, for we have not heard of this from our fathers of old."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So when Moses came to them with Our signs, clear signs, they said, 'This is nothing but a forged sorcery. We never heard of this among our fathers, the ancients.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when Musa came unto them with Our manifest signs, they said: this is naught but magic fabricated; and we heard not of this among our fathers of old.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when Musa (Moses) came to them with Our Clear Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), they said: "This is nothing but invented magic. Never did we hear of this among our fathers of old."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But when Moses came to them with Our signs, clear and manifest, they said, “This is nothing but fabricated magic, and We never heard of this from our ancestors of old.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But when Moses came to them with Our Clear Signs, they said: "This is nothing but a magic that has been contrived. We never heard anything like it from our ancestors of yore."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when Musa came to them with Our Clear Ayat, they said: "This is nothing but invented magic. Never did we hear of this among our fathers of old."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But when Moses came unto them with Our clear tokens, they said: This is naught but invented magic. We never heard of this among our fathers of old.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Moses brought them Our manifest signs, they said, ‘This is nothing but concocted magic. We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said: 'This is nothing but forged sorcery. We have never heard of this among our fathers, the ancients.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, "This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Moses came to them with Our miracles, they said, "These are only invented magic. We have never heard of such things from our fathers".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when Musa came to them with Our clear signs, they said: This is nothing but forged enchantment, and we never heard of it amongst our fathers of old.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said, "This is nothing but contrived magic. We never heard of this among our forefathers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said: "This is nothing but sorcery faked up: never did we head the like among our fathers of old!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But Moses said: "My Lord knows well who has come with guidance from Him, and for whom is the guerdon of Paradise. But surely the wicked will not prosper."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: But Moses said, 'My Lord knows very well who comes with the guidance from Him, and shall possess the Ultimate Abode; surely the evildoers will not prosper.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Musa said: My Lord best knoweth him who bringeth guidance from before Him and him whose will be the happy end of the Abode. Verily the wrong-doers shall not thrive.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "My Lord knows best him who came with guidance from Him, and whose will be the happy end in the Hereafter. Verily, the Zalimun (wrong-doers, polytheists and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah) will not be successful."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “My Lord is well aware of him who brings guidance from Him, and him who will have the sequel of the abode. The wrongdoers will not succeed.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses replied: "My Lord knows best who comes with guidance from Him, and also whose end will be the best in the Hereafter. As for the wrongdoers, they shall not prosper."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said: "My Lord knows best him who came with guidance from Him, and whose will be the happy end in the Hereafter. Verily, the wrongdoers will not be successful."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Moses said: My Lord is Best Aware of him who bringeth guidance from His presence, and whose will be the sequel of the Home (of bliss). Lo! wrong-doers will not be successful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said, ‘My Lord knows best who brings guidance from Him, and in whose favour the outcome of that abode will be. The wrongdoers will not be felicitous.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses replied: 'My Lord knows well who brings guidance from Him and who shall possess the Last Residence. The harmdoers will not prosper'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Moses said, "My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home. Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "My Lord knows best who has received guidance from Him and who will achieve a happy end. The unjust ones certainly will have no happiness."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Musa said: My Lord knows best who comes with guidance from Him, and whose shall be the good end of the abode; surely the unjust shall not be successful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And Moses replied, "My Lord knows best who comes with guidance from Him and who will attain the heavenly abode in the hereafter. The wrongdoers shall never prosper."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "My Lord knows best who it is that comes with guidance from Him and whose end will be best in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrong-doers will not prosper."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then after them We sent Moses and Aaron with Our signs to the Pharaoh and his nobles; but they behaved arrogantly, for they were a people full of guilt.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We sent forth, after them, Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his Council with Our signs, but they waxed proud, and were a sinful people.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then, after them, We raised Musa and Harun unto Fir'awn and his chiefs with Our signs, but they grew stiff-necked and they were a people guilty.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then after them We sent Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron) to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). But they behaved arrogantly and were Mujrimun (disbelievers, sinners, polytheists, criminals, etc.) folk.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then, after them, We sent Moses and Aaron with Our proofs to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. But they acted arrogantly. They were sinful people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then, after them, We sent forth Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs, but they waxed proud. They were a wickd people.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then after them We sent Musa and Harun to Fir`awn and his chiefs with Our Ayat. But they behaved arrogantly and were a people who were criminals.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then, after them, We sent Moses and Aaron unto Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our revelations, but they were arrogant and were a guilty folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then, after them, We sent Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his elite with Our signs, but they acted arrogantly and they were a guilty lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then, after them We sent Moses and Aaron with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council. But they were arrogant, for they were a sinful nation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and Aaron with Our miracles to the Pharaoh and his people. These people also proved to be arrogant. They were wicked people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then did We send up after them Musa and Haroun to Firon and his chiefs with Our signs, but they showed pride and they were a guilty people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We sent forth Moses and Aaron with Our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles, but they behaved arrogantly, for they were wicked people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then after them sent We Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our Signs. But they were arrogant: they were a people in sin.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "You say this of the truth," said Moses, "after it has come to you. Is this magic? But sorcerers do not ever prosper."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Moses said, 'What, do you say this to the truth, when it has come to you? Is this a sorcery? But sorcerers do not prosper.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: say ye this of the truth after it hath come unto you? Is this magic? and the magicians fare not well.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Say you (this) about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But the magicians will never be successful."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “Is this what you say of the truth when it has come to you? Is this sorcery? Sorcerers do not succeed.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: 'Do you say this about the truth after it has come to you? Is this sorcery? You call this sorcery although sorcerers never come to a happy end.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said: "Say you (this) about the truth when it has come to you Is this magic But the magicians will never be successful."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said: Speak ye (so) of the Truth when it hath come unto you? Is this magic? Now magicians thrive not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said, ‘Do you say of the truth when it comes to you [that it is magic]? Is this magic? Magicians do not find salvation.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said: 'Is this what you say of the truth when it has come to you? Is this sorcery? Sorcerers do not prosper'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Moses said, "Do you say [thus] about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But magicians will not succeed."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses asked, "Why do you call the Truth which has come to you magic? Magicians, certainly, will not have happiness".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Musa said: Do you say (this) of the truth when it has come to you? Is it magic? And the magicians are not successful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "Do you speak thus of the truth after it has been brought to you? Can this be sorcery? Sorcerers never prosper."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Moses: "Say ye (this) about the truth when it hath (actually) reached you? Is sorcery (like) this? But sorcerers will not prosper."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Have you come," said they, "to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing, so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land? We shall not believe in what you say.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Art thou come to us to turn us from that we found our fathers practising, and that the domination in the land might belong to you two? We do not believe you.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: art thou come unto us to turn us aside from that faith whereon We found our fathers, and that the greatness in the land shall be unto you twain! And for the sake of you twain we are not going to be believers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Have you come to us to turn us away from that (Faith) we found our fathers following, - and that you two may have greatness in the land? We are not going to believe you two!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Did you come to us to divert us from what we found our ancestors following, and so that you become prominent in the land? We will never believe in you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They replied: 'Have you come to turn us away from the way of our forefathers that the two of you might become supreme in the land? We shall never accept what the two of you say.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Have you come to us to turn us away from that we found our fathers following, and that you two may have greatness in the land We are not going to believe you two!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Hast thou come unto us to pervert us from that (faith) in which we found our fathers, and that you two may own the place of greatness in the land? We will not believe you two.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers following, so that supremacy may be yours in the land? We will not believe in the two of you.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Have you come to turn us away from that which we found our fathers practicing (in order that) the domination of the land might belong to you two? We do not believe you'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have grandeur in the land? And we are not believers in you."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They asked Moses, "Have you come to turn us away from the faith of our fathers and to make yourselves the rulers in the land? We shall never accept your faith."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers upon, and (that) greatness in the land should be for you two? And we are not going to believe in you.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Have you come to turn us away from what we found our forefathers following, so that the two of you might become supreme in this land? We will never believe in you."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "Hast thou come to us to turn us away from the ways we found our fathers following,- in order that thou and thy brother may have greatness in the land? But not we shall believe in you!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses nine clear signs; so ask the children of Israel. When (Moses) came to them the Pharaoh said: "I think, O Moses, you have been deluded."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses nine signs, clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel when he came to them, and Pharaoh said to him, 'Moses, I think thou art bewitched.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed unto Musa nine manifest signs - ask thou the Children of Israel--so when he came unto them, Fir'awn said unto him, verily imagine thee, O Musa! enchanted.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave to Musa (Moses) nine clear signs. Ask then the Children of Israel, when he came to them, then Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said to him: "O Musa (Moses)! I think you are indeed bewitched."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses nine clear signs—ask the Children of Israel. When he went to them, Pharaoh said to him, “I think that you, Moses, are bewitched.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We granted Moses nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about that: when these signs came forth, Pharaoh said to him: "Moses, I think that you are bewitched."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa nine clear signs. Ask then the Children of Israel, when he came to them, then Fir`awn said to him: "O Musa! I think you are indeed bewitched."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We gave unto Moses nine tokens, clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty). Do but ask the Children of Israel how he came unto them, then Pharaoh said unto him: Lo! I deem thee one bewitched, O Moses.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses nine manifest signs. So ask the Children of Israel. When he came to them, Pharaoh said to him, ‘O Moses, indeed I think you are bewitched.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: To Moses We gave nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about how he came to them. When Pharaoh said to him: 'Moses, I think you are bewitched.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Moses We gave nine illustrious miracles. Ask the Israelites; Moses came to them. The Pharaoh said to him,"Moses, I believe that you are bewitched".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave Musa nine clear signs; so ask the children of Israel. When he came to them, Firon said to him: Most surely I deem you, O Musa, to be a man deprived of reason.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We did indeed give Moses nine manifest signs; you can enquire from the Children of Israel. When he came to them, Pharaoh said to him, "Moses, I can see that you are bewitched."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: To Moses We did give Nine Clear Signs: As the Children of Israel: when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee, indeed, to have been worked upon by sorcery!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He replied: "You know that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these (signs) as cogent proof. I truly think, O Pharaoh, your days are done."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Indeed thou knowest that none sent these down, except the Lord of the heavens and earth, as clear proofs; and, Pharaoh, I think thou art accursed.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: assuredly thou knowest that none hath sent down these save the Lord of the heavens and the earth as an enlightenment; and verily imagine thee, Fir'awn, doomed.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Verily, you know that these signs have been sent down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as clear (evidences i.e. proofs of Allah's Oneness and His Omnipotence, etc.). And I think you are, indeed, O Fir'aun (Pharaoh) doomed to destruction (away from all good)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “You know that none sent these down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth—eye openers; and I think that you, Pharaoh, are doomed.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses replied: "You know well that no one but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these as eye-opening proofs. I truly think, O Pharaoh, that you are indeed doomed."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Verily, you know that these signs have been sent down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth. And I think you are indeed, O Fir`awn, doomed to destruction!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: In truth thou knowest that none sent down these (portents) save the Lord of the heavens and the earth as proofs, and lo! (for my part) I deem thee lost, O Pharaoh.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘You certainly know that no one has sent these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth, as eye-openers, and I, O Pharaoh, indeed think you are doomed.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'You know' he replied, 'that none except the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent down these as clear proofs. Pharaoh, I believe you are destroyed.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He replied, "Certainly you have come to know that these have been sent by the Lord of the heavens and the earth as lessons to people. Pharaoh, I believe that you are doomed to perdition.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Truly you know that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent down these as clear proof and most surely I believe you, O Firon, to be given over to perdition.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said, "You know full well that none has sent down these signs but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-opening evidence. Indeed, Pharaoh, I can see that you are doomed."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said, "Thou knowest well that these things have been sent down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-opening evidence: and I consider thee indeed, O Pharaoh, to be one doomed to destruction!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Musa with Our signs and a manifest authority.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), and a manifest authority,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs, and a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Verily We sent Moses with Our Signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa with Our Ayat, and a manifest authority,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and with clear authority

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our miracles and clear authority.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Musa with Our communications and clear authority,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Of old We sent Moses, with Our Signs and an authority manifest,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun. But they said: "He is only a deceiving sorcerer."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: to Pharaoh, Haman and Korah; they said, 'A lying sorcerer!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Unto Fir'awn and Haman and Qur'an, but they said: a magician, a liar.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: To Fir'aun (Pharaoh), Haman and Qarun (Korah), but they called (him): "A sorcerer, a liar!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: To Pharaoh, Hamaan, and Quaroon. But they said, “A lying sorcerer.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: to Pharaoh and Haman and Korah. They said: “(He is) a sorcerer, an utter liar.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: To Fir`awn, Haman and Qarun, but they called (him): "A sorcerer, a liar!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Unto Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they said: A lying sorcerer!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: to Pharaoh, Haman and Korah, but they said, ‘A magician and a mendacious liar.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: to Pharaoh, Haman, and Korah. But they said: 'A sorcerer, a liar'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun; but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: to the Pharaoh, Haman, and Korah, who said, "He is only a lying magician.".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: To Firon and Haman and Qaroun, but they said: A lying magician.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: to Pharaoh, Haman and Korah. But they said, "A magician, a liar."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: To Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun; but they called (him)" a sorcerer telling lies!"...

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Let me kill Moses," the Pharaoh said, "and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he will change your faith and spread corruption in the land."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Pharaoh said, 'Let me slay Moses, and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he may change, your religion, or that he may cause corruption to appear in the land.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Fir'awn said: let me alone, that may slay Musa, and let him call upon his Lord. Verily fear that he may change your religion or that he may cause to appear in the land corruption.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Leave me to kill Musa (Moses), and let him call his Lord (to stop me from killing him)! I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh said, “Leave me to kill Moses, and let him appeal to his Lord. I fear he may change your religion, or spread disorder in the land.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: One day Pharaoh said: “Let me go and kill Moses; then let him invoke his Lord. I fear that he will change your religion or cause disruption in the land.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Fir`awn said: "Leave me to kill Musa, and let him call his Lord! I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto his Lord. Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he will cause confusion in the land.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Pharaoh said, ‘Let me slay Moses, and let him invoke his Lord. Indeed I fear that he will change your religion, or bring forth corruption in our land.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh said: 'Let me kill Moses, then let him call to his Lord! I am fearful that he will change your religion or cause mischief in the land'

translation.author: Saheeh International
