translation.text: And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption in the land."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call for help from his Lord. I am afraid that he will change your religion or spread evil through the land.".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon said: Let me alone that I may slay Musa and let him call upon his Lord; surely I fear that he will change your religion or that he will make mischief to appear in the land.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses, let him call upon his Lord, I fear that he may cause you to change your religion, or that he may cause disorder in the land."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Pharaoh: "Leave me to slay Moses; and let him call on his Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion, or lest he should cause mischief to appear in the land!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every insolent imposter who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Moses said, 'I take refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every man who is proud, and believes not in the Day of Reckoning.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Musa said: verily I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every stiff-necked person who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said: "Verily, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the Day of Reckoning!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “I have sought the protection of my Lord and your Lord, from every tyrant who does not believe in the Day of Account.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: “I have taken refuge with my Lord and your Lord from everyone who waxes arrogant and does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said: "Verily, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the Day of Reckoning!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said: Lo! I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every scorner who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said, ‘I seek the protection of my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said: 'I take refuge in my Lord and in your Lord from every proud (person), who does not believe in Day of Reckoning'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "I seek protection from your and my Lord against every arrogant person who has no faith in the Day of Judgment."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Musa said: Surely I take refuge with my Lord and-- your Lord from every proud one who does not believe in the day of reckoning.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "I seek refuge with my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant person who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day of Account!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: A believer from the House of Pharaoh who had kept his faith to himself, said: "Will you kill a man because he says: 'My Lord is God,' when he has brought clear signs from his Lord to you? If he is a liar his lie will recoil back on him; but in case he speaks the truth, then what he predicts will befall you. Surely God does not show the way to the shameful liar.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then said a certain man, a believer 'of Pharaoh's folk that kept hidden his belief, 'What, will you slay a man because he says, "My Lord is God," yet he has brought you the clear signs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying is upon his own head; but if he is truthful, somewhat of that he promises you will smite you. Surely God guides not him who is prodigal and a liar.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And a believing man of Fir'awn 's household, hiding his belief, said: would ye slay a man because he saith: my Lord is God, and hath come upto you with evidences from your Lord? If he is a liar, then upon him will be his lie, and if he is a truth-teller, then there will befall you some of that wherewith he threateneth you; verily God guideth not one who is an extravagant and a liar.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And a believing man of Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) family, who hid his faith said: "Would you kill a man because he says: My Lord is Allah, and he has come to you with clear signs (proofs) from your Lord? And if he is a liar, upon him will be (the sin of) his lie; but if he is telling the truth, then some of that (calamity) wherewith he threatens you will befall on you." Verily, Allah guides not one who is a Musrif (a polytheist, or a murderer who shed blood without a right, or those who commit great sins, oppressor, transgressor), a liar!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: A believing man from Pharaoh's family, who had concealed his faith, said, “Are you going to kill a man for saying, `My Lord is God,’ and he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying will rebound upon him; but if he is truthful, then some of what he promises you will befall you. God does not guide the extravagant imposter.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then a man endowed with faith, from Pharaoh's folk, who had kept his faith hidden, said: “Do you kill a person simply because he says: 'My Lord is Allah' even though he brought to you clear Signs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying will recoil upon him; but if he is truthful, you will be smitten with some of the awesome consequences of which he warns you. Allah does not guide to the Right Way any who exceeds the limits and is an utter liar.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And a believing man of Fir`awn's family, who hid his Faith said: "Would you kill a man because he says: `My Lord is Allah,' and he has come to you with clear signs from your Lord And if he is a liar, upon him will be (the sin of) his lie; but if he is telling the truth, then some of that (calamity) wherewith he threatens you will befall on you." Verily, Allah guides not one who is a transgressor, a liar!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And a believing man of Pharaoh's family, who hid his faith, said: Would ye kill a man because he saith: My Lord is Allah, and hath brought you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is lying, then his lie is upon him; and if he is truthful, then some of that wherewith he threateneth you will strike you. Lo! Allah guideth not one who is a prodigal, a liar.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Said a man of faith from Pharaoh’s clan, who concealed his faith, ‘Will you kill a man for saying, ‘‘My Lord is Allah,’’ while he has already brought you manifest proofs from your Lord? Should he be lying, his falsehood will be to his own detriment; but if he is truthful, there shall visit you some of what he promises you. Indeed Allah does not guide someone who is a transgressor and liar.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But one of Pharaoh's people, who was in secret a believer, asked: 'Would you kill a man because he says: "My Lord is Allah?" He has brought you clear signs from your Lord. If he is lying, let his lie be on his head, but, if he is speaking the truth then at least a part of what he promises will befall you. Allah does not guide the lying sinner.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is Allah' while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: A believing person from the people of the Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Would you kill a man just because he says God is my Lord? He has brought you illustrious miracles from your Lord. If he speaks lies, it will only harm him, but if he speaks the Truth, some of his warnings may affect you. God does not guide a transgressing liar.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And a believing man of Firon's people who hid his faith said: What! will you slay a man because he says: My Lord is Allah, and indeed he has brought to you clear arguments from your Lord? And if he be a liar, on him will be his lie, and if he be truthful, there will befall you some of that which he threatens you (with); surely Allah does not guide him who is extravagant, a liar:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: A believer, a man from among the people of Pharaoh, who had concealed his faith, said, "Would you slay a man merely because he says, "My Lord is God." He has brought you clear signs from your Lord, and if he is lying, the sin of his will be on his own head; but if he is truthful, a part of that of which he warns you will surely befall you. Certainly, God does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: A believer, a man from among the people of Pharaoh, who had concealed his faith, said: "Will ye slay a man because he says, 'My Lord is Allah'?- when he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs) from your Lord? and if he be a liar, on him is (the sin of) his lie: but, if he is telling the Truth, then will fall on you something of the (calamity) of which he warns you: Truly Allah guides not one who transgresses and lies!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O my people, authority is yours today being the most powerful in the land; but who will save us from the scourge of God if it fall upon us?" "I show you," said the Pharaoh, "only what I see (is right), and guide you but to the right path."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: O my people, today the kingdom is yours, who are masters in the land. But who will help us, against the might of God, if it comes upon us?' Said Pharaoh, 'I only let you see what I see; I only guide you in the way of rectitude.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O My people! yours is the the dominion to-day: ye being overcomers in the land; but who will succour us aginst the scourge of God if it cometh Unto us! Fir'awn said: I shew you only that which see, and I guide you but to the path of rectitude.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O my people! Yours is the kingdom this day, you are uppermost in the land. But who will save us from the Torment of Allah, should it befall us?" Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "I show you only that which I see (correct), and I guide you only to the path of right policy!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O my people! Yours is the dominion today, supreme in the land; but who will help us against God’s might, should it fall upon us?” Pharaoh said, “I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the path of prudence.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?” Pharaoh said: “I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri

translation.author: Pickthall

translation.author: Qarai

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: My people, today you have the kingdom and the power on earth but who will help us against the wrath of God if it will befall us?" The Pharaoh said, "I show you only what I think is proper and guide you only to the right direction".

translation.author: Shakir

translation.text: The Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I am not aware of any other lord of yours but myself. So, O Haman, fire some clay (bricks) to build a tower for me that I may mount up (and see) the God of Moses; for I think he is a liar."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And Moses said: "O Lord, have You bestowed on the Pharaoh and his nobles pomp and plenty in the life of this world that they might mislead people from Your path? Destroy their possessions, O Lord, and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they face the painful punishment."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Moses said, 'Our Lord, Thou hast given to Pharaoh and his Council adornment and possessions in this present life. Our Lord, let them go astray from Thy way; Our Lord, obliterate their possessions, and harden their hearts so that they do not believe, till they see the painful chastisement.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Musa said: our Lord! verily Thou! Thou hast vouchsafed unto Fir'awn and his chiefs adornment and riches in the life of the world, Our Lord, that they may lead men astray from Thine way. Our Lord! wipe out their riches, and harden their hearts, so that they may not believe until they behold the torment afflictive.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Musa (Moses) said: "Our Lord! You have indeed bestowed on Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord! That they may lead men astray from Your Path. Our Lord! Destroy their wealth, and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe until they see the painful torment."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “Our Lord, you have given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the worldly life. Our Lord, for them to lead away from Your path. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth, and harden their hearts, they will not believe until they see the painful torment.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses prayed: 'Our Lord! You bestowed upon Pharaoh and his nobles splendour and riches in the world. Our Lord! Have You done this that they may lead people astray from Your path? Our Lord! Obliterate their riches and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they observe the painful chastisement.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Musa said: "Our Lord! You have indeed bestowed on Fir`awn and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord! That they may lead men astray from Your path. Our Lord! Destroy their wealth, and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe until they see the painful torment."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Moses said: Our Lord! Lo! Thou hast given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendour and riches in the life of the world, Our Lord! that they may lead men astray from Thy way. Our Lord! Destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they believe not till they see the painful doom.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said, ‘Our Lord! You have given Pharaoh and his elite glamour and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord, that they may lead [people] astray from Your way! Our Lord! Blot out their wealth and harden their hearts so that they do not believe until they sight the painful punishment.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Our Lord' supplicated Moses. 'You have given Pharaoh and his Council adornments and possessions in this life. Our Lord, let them go astray from YourPath. Our Lord, destroy their possessions and harden their hearts so that they shall not believe until they see the painful punishment.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Moses said, "Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "Lord, You have given the Pharaoh and his people great riches and splendor in this life and this makes them stray from Your path. Lord, destroy their wealth and harden their hearts in disbelief so that they will suffer the most painful torment".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Musa said: Our Lord! surely Thou hast given to Firon and his chiefs finery and riches in this world's life, to this end, our Lord, that they lead (people) astray from Thy way: Our Lord! destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they believe not until they see the painful punishment.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses prayed, "Our Lord, You have bestowed upon Pharaoh and his nobles pomp and wealth in the present life, whereby they lead people astray from Your path. Our Lord, destroy their riches and harden their hearts, so that they shall not believe until they are faced with grievous punishment."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses prayed: "Our Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on Pharaoh and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of the present, and so, Our Lord, they mislead (men) from Thy Path. Deface, our Lord, the features of their wealth, and send hardness to their hearts, so they will not believe until they see the grievous penalty."

So you both keep to the Straight Way (i.e. keep on doing good deeds and preaching Allah's Message with patience), and follow not the path of those who know not (the truth i.e. to believe in the Oneness of Allah, and also to believe in the Reward of Allah: Paradise, etc.)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "He wishes to drive you away from the land. So what do you advise?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: who desires to expel you from your land; what do you command?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He would drive you forth from your land; so what is it that ye enjoin?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "He wants to get you out of your land, so what do you advise?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “He wants to evict you from your land, so what do you recommend?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: who seeks to drive you out from your land. What would you have us do?'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "He wants to get you out of your land, so what do you advise"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Who would expel you from your land. Now what do ye advise?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: he seeks to expel you from your land.’ ‘So what do you advise?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: who seeks to drive you from your land what do you command'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and said, "He wants to expel you from your land." They asked (others), " what is your opinion in the matter?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He intends to turn you out of your land. What counsel do you then give?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: who seeks to drive you from your land!" Pharaoh said, "What then do you advise?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "His plan is to get you out of your land: then what is it ye counsel?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "Put him and his brother off (awhile) and send out heralds to the cities

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Put him and his brother off a while, and send among the cities musterers,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: put him and his bro ther off, and send unto the cities callers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Put him and his brother off (for a time), and send callers (men) to the cities to collect (and) -

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Put him off, and his brother, and send heralds to the cities.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then they advised Pharaoh: 'Put off Moses and his brother for a while, and send forth heralds to your cities

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Put him and his brother off (for a time), and send callers to the cities to collect"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said (unto Pharaoh): Put him off (a while) - him and his brother - and send into the cities summoners,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Put him and his brother off for a while, and send heralds to the cities,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Others said: 'Put them off a while, he and his brother, and send forth to your cities gatherers

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The others suggested holding Moses and his brother off and sending to all the cities

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Put him off and his brother, and send collectors into the cities:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Let him and his brother wait awhile, and send into the cities summoners,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while); and send to the cities men to collect-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "To bring all the wise magicians to you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: to bring thee every cunning sorcerer.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: That they may bring to thee every magician knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "That they bring up to you all well-versed sorcerers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “And let them bring you every skillful magician.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: to summon every skilful magician to your presence.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "That they bring to you all well-versed sorcerers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: To bring each knowing wizard unto thee.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: to bring you every expert magician.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: to summon every wellversed sorcerer to you'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Who will bring you every learned magician."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: to bring together at the Pharaohs court all the skillful magicians.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: That they may bring to you every enchanter possessed of knowledge.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: who should bring to you every skillful magician."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The magicians came to the Pharaoh and said: "Is there reward for us if we succeed?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And the sorcerers came to Pharaoh, saying, 'We shall surely have a wage, if we should be the victors?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the magicians came unto Fir'awn. They said: surely there is for us a reward if we are the overcomers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And so the sorcerers came to Fir'aun (Pharaoh). They said: "Indeed there will be a (good) reward for us if we are the victors."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The magicians came to Pharaoh, and said, “Surely there is a reward for us, if we are the victors.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And the magicians came to Pharaoh and said: 'Shall we have a reward if we win?'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And so the sorcerers came to Fir`awn. They said: "Indeed there will be a (good) reward for us if we are the victors."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the wizards came to Pharaoh, saying: Surely there will be a reward for us if we are victors.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, ‘We shall indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The sorcerers came to Pharaoh. They said: 'Shall we be rewarded if we are the winners'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The magicians came to the Pharaoh and said, "We must have our reward if we are to gain a victory over him (Moses)".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the enchanters came to Firon (and) said: We must surely have a reward if we are the prevailing ones.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And the magicians came to Pharaoh and asked, "Shall we have a reward, if we should prevail?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So there came the sorcerers to Pharaoh: They said, "of course we shall have a (suitable) reward if we win!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Yes," said he, "you will be among the honoured."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'Yes, indeed; and you shall be among the near-stationed.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: yea! and verily ye shall be of those brought nigh.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Yes, and moreover you will (in that case) be of the nearest (to me)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Yes, and you will be among my favorites.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh replied: 'Certainly, and you shall be among those who are near to me.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Yes, and moreover you will (in that case) be of the nearest (to me)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He answered: Yes, and surely ye shall be of those brought near (to me).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Of course! And indeed you shall be among those near [to me].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Yes' he answered, 'and you will be among those near'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh replied, "In addition to your rewards, you will become my close friends thereafter."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Yes, and you shall certainly be of those who are near (to me).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh replied, "Certainly, and you shall also become my courtiers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So they said: "O Moses, you may cast your spell first, or we shall cast ours."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Moses, wilt thou cast, or shall we be the casters?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: O Musa! either thou cast down, or we shall be the ones to cast down.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "O Musa (Moses)! Either you throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O Moses! Either you throw, or we are the ones to throw.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then they said: 'O Moses, will you [first] throw your rod, or shall we throw?'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "O Musa! Either you throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: O Moses! Either throw (first) or let us be the first throwers?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘O Moses, will you throw [first], or shall we throw?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Moses, will you throw first or shall we be the throwers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The magicians asked Moses, "Will you throw your staff first or shall we?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: O Musa! will you cast, or shall we be the first to cast?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Moses, will you first throw, or shall we?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "O Moses! wilt thou throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "You cast it first," answered Moses. When they cast their spell, they bewitched the eyes of the people and petrified them by conjuring up a great charm.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'You cast.' And when they cast they put a Spell upon the people's eyes, and called forth fear of them, and produced a mighty sorcery.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: cast ye. Then when they cast clown, they enchanted the eyes of the people, and terrified them and brought mighty magic to bear.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He [Musa (Moses)] said: "Throw you (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them, and they displayed a great magic.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “You throw!” And when they threw, they beguiled the eyes of the people, and intimidated them, and produced a mighty magic.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: 'You throw.' So when they threw [their rods], they enchanted the eyes of the people, and struck them with awe, and produced a mighty sorcery.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He [Musa] said: "Throw you (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them, and they displayed a great trick.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Throw! And when they threw they cast a spell upon the people's eyes, and overawed them, and produced a mighty spell.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Throw [yours].’ So when they threw, they bewitched the people’s eyes and overawed them, producing a tremendous magic.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Throw' he replied. And when they threw, they bewitched the people's eyes and terrified them, and produced great sorcery.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He replied, "Throw yours first." Their great magic bewitched people's eyes and terrified them.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Cast. So when they cast, they deceived the people's eyes and frightened them, and they produced a mighty enchantment.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said, "You throw [first]!" When they made their cast, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck them with awe, for they showed a great [feat of] magic.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Moses: "Throw ye (first)." So when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people, and struck terror into them: for they showed a great (feat of) magic.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We said to Moses: "Throw down your staff;" and it swallowed up their conjurations in no time.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We revealed to Moses: 'Cast thy staff!' And lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And we revealed unto Musa: cast down thy rod. And lo! it Was swallowing up that which they had feigned.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Throw your stick," and behold! It swallowed up straight away all the falsehoods which they showed.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We inspired Moses: “Throw your staff.” And at once, it swallowed what they were faking.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We directed Moses: 'Now you throw your rod.' And lo! it swallowed up all their false devices.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We revealed to Musa (saying): "Throw your stick," and behold! It swallowed up straight away all the falsehood which they showed.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We inspired Moses (saying): Throw thy staff! And lo! it swallowed up their lying show.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And We signalled to Moses: ‘Throw down your staff.’ And behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses: 'Now, throw down your staff' And thereupon it swallowed up their false invention.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We inspired Moses to throw his staff, and suddenly it began to swallow-up all that the magicians had (falsely) invented.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We revealed to Musa, saying: Cast your rod; then lo! it devoured the lies they told.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We inspired Moses, saying, "Throw down your staff." And it immediately swallowed up their false devices.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We put it into Moses's mind by inspiration: "Throw (now) thy rod": and behold! it swallows up straight away all the falsehoods which they fake!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Bring the cleverest magicians to me," said the Pharaoh.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'Bring me every cunning sorcerer.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Firawn said: bring unto me every magician knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Bring to me every well-versed sorcerer."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh said, “Bring me every experienced sorcerer.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Pharaoh said (to his) men: 'Bring every skilled sorcerer to me.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Fir`awn said: "Bring me every well-versed sorcerer."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh said: Bring every cunning wizard unto me.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Pharaoh said, ‘Bring me every expert magician.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Then) Pharaoh said: 'Bring every skilled sorcerer'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Pharaoh said, "Bring to me every learned magician."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh ordered every skillful magician to come into his presence.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon said: Bring to me every skillful magician.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then Pharaoh said, "Bring me every skilled magician!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Pharaoh: "Bring me every sorcerer well versed."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So when the magicians arrived, Moses said to them: "Cast whatever (spell) you have to cast."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then, when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, 'Cast you down what you will cast.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when the magicians were come, Musa said unto them: cast down that which ye are going to cast down.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when the sorcerers came, Musa (Moses) said to them: "Cast down what you want to cast!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you have to throw.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And when the sorcerers came Moses said to them: 'Cast whatever you wish to cast.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when the sorcerers came, Musa said to them: "Cast down what you want to cast!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the wizards came, Moses said unto them: Cast your cast!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, ‘Throw down what you have to throw.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When the sorcerers came, Moses said to them: 'Cast down what you will cast'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you will throw."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When all the magicians were brought to his court, Moses asked them to cast down what they wanted to.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when the magicians came, Musa said to them: Cast down what you have to cast.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Cast down whatever you are going to cast down."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When the sorcerers came, Moses said to them: "Throw ye what ye (wish) to throw!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When they had cast (their spell) Moses said: "What you have cast is only a charm which God will surely nullify. God does not verily render the deeds of evil-doers righteous.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then, when they had cast, Moses said, 'What you have brought is sorcery; God will assuredly bring it to naught. God sets not right the work of those who do corruption.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when they had cast down, Musa said: that which ye have brought is magic, verily Allah will soon make it vain; verily Allah setteth not right the work of the corrupters.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when they had cast down, Musa (Moses) said: "What you have brought is sorcery, Allah will surely make it of no effect. Verily, Allah does not set right the work of Al-Mufsidun (the evil-doers, corrupts, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when they threw, Moses said, “What you produced is sorcery, and God will make it fail. God does not foster the efforts of the corrupt.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then when they had cast (their staffs), Moses said: 'What you have produced is sheer sorcery. Allah will certainly reduce it to naught. Surely Allah does not set right the work of the mischief-makers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when they had cast down, Musa said: "What you have brought is sorcery, Allah will surely make it of no effect. Verily, Allah does not set right the work of the evildoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when they had cast, Moses said: That which ye have brought is magic. Lo! Allah will make it vain. Lo! Allah upholdeth not the work of mischief-makers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So when they threw down [their sticks and ropes], Moses said, ‘What you have produced is magic. Indeed Allah will bring it to naught presently. Indeed Allah does not foster the efforts of those who cause corruption.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when they had cast, Moses said: 'What you have brought is sorcery. Surely, Allah will render it as nothing. Allah does not put right the work of the corrupt'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when they had thrown, Moses said, "What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, Allah will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, Allah does not amend the work of corrupters.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the magicians had thrown theirs, Moses said, "What you have performed is magic. God will certainly prove it to be false; He will not make the deeds of the corrupt people righteous.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when they cast down, Musa said to them: What you have brought is deception; surely Allah will make it naught; surely Allah does not make the work of mischief-makers to thrive.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And when they had done so, Moses said, "What you have wrought is mere sorcery. Surely, God will bring it to nothing. Truly, God does not support the work of mischief-makers;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When they had had their throw, Moses said: "What ye have brought is sorcery: Allah will surely make it of no effect: for Allah prospereth not the work of those who make mischief.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Said (Moses): "Let your meeting be on the day of the Feast, and let people assemble in broad daylight."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Your tryst shall be upon the Feast Day.' said Moses. 'Let the people be mustered at the high noon.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: your appointment is the gala day, and that the people be gathered in the forenoon.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Your appointed meeting is the day of the festival, and let the people assemble when the sun has risen (forenoon)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Your appointment is the day of the festival, so let the people be gathered together at mid-morning.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "The appointment to meet you is on the Day of the Feast and let all people come together before noon."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "Your appointed meeting is the day of the festival, and let the people assemble when the sun has risen (forenoon)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Moses) said: Your tryst shall be the day of the feast, and let the people assemble when the sun hath risen high.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Your tryst shall be the Day of Adornment, and let the people be assembled in early forenoon.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Moses) replied: 'Your meeting shall be on the day of the feast, and let the people be assembled by midmorning'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "Let the contest take place on the Day of Feast so that all the people can come together during the brightness of the day."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (Musa) said: Your appointment is the day of the Festival and let the people be gathered together in the early forenoon.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "The day of the encounter will be the day of the festival, and let the people assemble when the sun has risen high."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival, and let the people be assembled when the sun is well up."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: After this the Pharaoh withdrew and settled his stratagem, then came back.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh then withdrew, and gathered his guile. Thereafter he came again,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then Firawn turned away, devised his stratagem; thereafter he came.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So Fir'aun (Pharaoh) withdrew, devised his plot and then came back.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh turned away, put together his plan, and then came back.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh went back and concerted all his stratagem and returned for the encounter.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So Fir`awn withdrew, devised his plot and then came back.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then Pharaoh went and gathered his strength, then came (to the appointed tryst).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Pharaoh withdrew [to consult privately], summoned up his guile, and then arrived [at the scene of the contest].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So Pharaoh withdrew and gathered his guile, then returned,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh returned to organize his plans and then attended the appointment.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So Firon turned his back and settled his plan, then came.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So Pharaoh withdrew, devised his stratagem and returned.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So Pharaoh withdrew: He concerted his plan, and then came (back).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said to them: "Woe betide you. Do not fabricate a lie against God, or He will destroy you with some affliction. For he who fabricates lies is doomed to failure."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and Moses said to them, 'O beware! Forge not a lie against God, lest He destroy you with a chastisement. Whoso forges has ever failed.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said unto them: woe unto you! fabricate not against Allah a lie, lest he extirpate you with a torment, and surely He who fabricateth, loseth.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said to them: "Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you completely by a torment. And surely, he who invents a lie (against Allah) will fail miserably."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said to them, “Woe to you. Do not fabricate lies against God, or He will destroy you with a punishment. He who invents lies will fail.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (At the time of the encounter) Moses said to them: "Woe to you! Do not invent falsehoods against Allah lest He destroy you with a scourge. Surely those who invent lies shall come to grief."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said to them: "Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you completely by a torment. And surely, he who invents a lie (against Allah) will fail miserably."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Moses said unto them: Woe unto you! Invent not a lie against Allah, lest He extirpate you by some punishment. He who lieth faileth miserably.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said to them, ‘Woe to you! Do not fabricate lies against Allah, or He will obliterate you with a punishment. Whoever fabricates lies certainly fails.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
