translation.text: Fir`awn said: "You have believed in him [Musa] before I gave you permission. Surely, this is a plot which you have plotted in the city to drive out its people, but you shall come to know."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Pharaoh said: Ye believe in Him before I give you leave! Lo! this is the plot that ye have plotted in the city that ye may drive its people hence. But ye shall come to know!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Pharaoh said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I may permit you? It is indeed a plot you have devised in the city to expel its people from it. Soon you will know [the consequences]!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh said: 'Do you believe in Him before I permit? This is a plot that you have contrived in the city in order to expel its people from it. Now you shall know!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said to the magicians, "You declared your belief in him (Moses) without my permission. This is a plot to throw my people out of their city. But you will soon know.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Firon said: Do you believe in Him before I have given you permission? Surely this is a plot which you have secretly devised in this city, that you may turn out of it its people, but you shall know:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "You dare believe in Him before I have given you permission? Behold, this is indeed a plot which you have devised in this city in order to drive its people out. But you shall soon know the consequences,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Pharaoh: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this is a trick which ye have planned in the city to drive out its people: but soon shall ye know (the consequences).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The magicians, (seeing the miracle), fell down in prostration, saying: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And the sorcerers cast themselves down prostrating. 'We believe,' they said, 'in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then the magicians were cast down prostrate; they said: we believe in the Lord of Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Harun (Aaron) and Musa (Moses)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And the magicians fell down prostrate. They said, “We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Eventually the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate and said: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So the magicians fell down prostrate. They said: "We believe in the Lord of Harun and Musa."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then the wizards were (all) flung down prostrate, crying: We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereat the magicians fell down prostrating. They said, ‘We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Thereafter the sorcerers threw themselves down, prostrating, saying: 'We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The magicians bowed down in prostration saying, "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the magicians were cast down making obeisance; they said: We believe in the Lord of Haroun and Musa.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The magicians then prostrated themselves. They said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The Pharaoh) said: "You have come to believe without my dispensation. Surely he is your chief who taught you magic. I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides and crucify you on the trunks of date-palm trees. You will come to know whose punishment is harder and protracted."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh said, 'Have you believed him before I gave you leave? Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you upon the trunks of palm-trees; you shall know of a certainty which of us is more terrible in chastisement, and more abiding.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said; believed ye in him ere I gave you leave! verily he is your chief who hath taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on the opposite sides, and will surely crucify you on the trunks of palm-trees, and ye shall surely know whichever of us is severer in torment and more lasting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Believe you in him [Musa (Moses)] before I give you permission? Verily! He is your chief who taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you on the trunks of date-palms, and you shall surely know which of us [I (Fir'aun - Pharaoh) or the Lord of Musa (Moses) (Allah)] can give the severe and more lasting torment."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Did you believe in him before I have given you permission? He must be your chief, who has taught you magic. I will cut off your hands and your feet on alternate sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of the palm-trees. Then you will know which of us is more severe in punishment, and more lasting.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "What! Did you believe in Him even before I permitted you to do so? Surely, he must be your chief who taught you magic. Now I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and will crucify you on the trunks of palm-trees, and then you will come to know which of us can inflict sterner and more lasting torment."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Fir`awn) said: "Believe you in him before I give you permission Verily, he is your chief who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you on the trunks of date palms, and you shall surely know which of us can give the severe and more lasting torment. "

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he is your chief who taught you magic. Now surely I shall cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and I shall crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and ye shall know for certain which of us hath sterner and more lasting punishment.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Did you believe in him before I should permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Surely, I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will know which of us can inflict a severer and more lasting punishment.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Have you believed him before I have given you permission' he (Pharaoh) said. 'Indeed, he (must be) your chief, the one who taught you sorcery. I will cut off on opposite sides a hand and a foot then crucify you on the trunks of palmtrees. Indeed, you shall know whose punishment is more stern, and more lasting'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "Since you believed in him without my permission, then Moses certainly must be your chief who has taught you magic. I shall cut your hands and feet on alternate sides and crucify you on the trunk of the palm-tree. You shall certainly find which among us can afflict a more severe and lasting punishment".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (Firon) said: You believe in him before I give you leave; most surely he is the chief of you who taught you enchantment, therefore I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will certainly crucify you on the trunks of the palm trees, and certainly you will come to know which of us is the more severe and the more abiding in chastising.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Have you believed in him before I permit you? He must be your master who has taught you magic. I will cut your hands and feet off on opposite sides, and have you crucified on the trunks of palm-trees. You shall know whose punishment is more severe and more lasting."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader, who has taught you magic! be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: so shall ye know for certain, which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting punishment!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We have certainly come to believe in our Lord that He may forgive our trespasses and the magic you have forced us to perform, for God is nobler and abiding."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We believe in our Lord, that He may pardon us our offences, and the sorcery thou hast constrained us to practise; God is better, and more abiding.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily we! we have believed in our Lord, that he may forgive us our faults, and that to which thou hast constrained us in the way of magic; and Allah is Best and Most Lasting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Verily! We have believed in our Lord, that He may forgive us our faults, and the magic to which you did compel us. And Allah is better as regards reward in comparison to your [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh)] reward, and more lasting (as regards punishment in comparison to your punishment)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We have believed in our Lord, so that He may forgive us our sins, and the magic you have compelled us to practice. God is Better, and more Lasting.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and also forgive us the practice of magic to which you had compelled us. Allah is the Best and He alone will abide."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Verily, we have believed in our Lord, that He may forgive us our faults, and the magic to which you did compel us. And Allah is better as regards reward in comparison to your reward, and more lasting."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! we believe in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the magic unto which thou didst force us. Allah is better and more lasting.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We have indeed believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our offences and the magic you compelled us to perform. Allah is better and more lasting.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We believe in our Lord so that He forgives us our sins and the sorcery you have forced us to practice. Allah is Better, and Everlasting'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have faith in our Lord so that He will forgive our sins and our magical performances that you forced us to show. God is better than all things and His rewards last longer."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely we believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and the magic to which you compelled us; and Allah is better and more abiding.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: we have believed in our Lord so that He may forgive us our sins and forgive us the sorcery that you have forced us to practice. God is the best and the most abiding."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "For us, we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults, and the magic to which thou didst compel us: for Allah is Best and Most Abiding."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: The Lord of Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "The Lord of Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "The Lord of Musa and Harun."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The Lord of Musa and Haroun.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said Pharaoh, 'You have believed him before I gave you leave. Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; now you shall know! I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you all together.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Fir'awn said: ye believed in him ere I gave you leave. Verily he is your chief who hath taught you magic, so ye shall surely come to know. Surely I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and surely I shall crucify you all.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] said: "You have believed in him before I give you leave. Surely, he indeed is your chief, who has taught you magic! So verily, you shall come to know. Verily, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Did you believe in Him before I have given you permission? He must be your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon know. I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said: "You accepted the word of Moses even before I granted you the leave to do so. Surely he is your chief who has taught you magic. Soon shall you come to know. I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and shall crucify all of you."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "You have believed in him before I give you leave. Surely, he indeed is your chief, who has taught you magic! So verily, you shall come to know. Verily, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know. Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you every one.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He [i.e. Pharaoh] said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I should permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Soon you will know! I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will crucify you all.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) said: 'You have believed him before I have given you permission. He is the chief of you who has taught you sorcery. But you shall know. I will surely cut off on opposite sides a hand and a foot, and crucify you all.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "You believed without my permission? He seems to be your chief who has taught you magic. But you will soon know (the result of what you have done).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Said he: You believe in him before I give you permission; most surely he is the chief of you who taught you the magic, so you shall know: certainly I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and certainly I will crucify you all.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "Have you come to believe in him, before I have given you permission? He is surely your master who has taught you magic. But you shall see. I will cut off your hands and feet on alternate sides and crucify you all."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? surely he is your leader, who has taught you sorcery! but soon shall ye know! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We certainly hope our Lord will forgive our sins as we are the first to believe."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We are eager that our Lord should forgive us our offences, for that we are the first of the believers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily we long that our Lord shall forgive us our faults because we have been the first of the believers

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Verily! We really hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers [in Musa (Moses) and in the Monotheism which he has brought from Allah]."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We are eager for our Lord to forgive us our sins, since we are the first of the believers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and we surely expect that Our Lord will forgive us our sins for we are the first ones to believe."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Verily, we really hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are the first of the believers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed we hope our Lord will forgive us our offences for being the first to believe.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We are eager that Our Lord should forgive us our offenses, for we are the first of the believers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "It does not matter. We shall be returning to our Lord.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely we hope that our Lord will forgive us our wrongs because we are the first of the believers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We hope our Lord will forgive us, as we are the first of the believers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Only, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults, that we may become foremost among the believers!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But none of them put faith in Moses except some youths among his people who were nonetheless afraid lest the Pharaoh and his nobles should persecute them; for the Pharaoh was mighty in the land, and guilty of excesses.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So none believed in Moses, save a seed of his people, for fear of Pharaoh and their Council, that they would persecute them; and Pharaoh was high in the land, and he was one of the prodigals.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then none believed in Musa save a posterity of his people, through fear of Fir'awn and their chiefs, lest he should persecute them; and verily Fir'awn was lofty in the land, and verily he was of the extravagant.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: But none believed in Musa (Moses) except the offspring of his people, because of the fear of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and verily, Fir'aun (Pharaoh) was arrogant tyrant on the earth, he was indeed one of the Musrifun (polytheists, sinners and transgressors, those who give up the truth and follow the evil, and commit all kinds of great sins).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But none believed in Moses except some children of his people, for fear that Pharaoh and his chiefs would persecute them. Pharaoh was high and mighty in the land. He was a tyrant.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: None but a few youths of Moses' people accepted him, fearing that Pharaoh and their own chiefs would persecute them. Indeed Pharaoh was mighty in the land, he was among those who exceed all limits.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: But none believed in Musa except the offspring of his people, because of the fear of Fir`awn and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and verily, Fir`awn was an arrogant tyrant on the earth, he was indeed one of the transgressors.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But none trusted Moses, save some scions of his people, (and they were) in fear of Pharaoh and their chiefs, that he would persecute them. Lo! Pharaoh was verily a tyrant in the land, and lo! he verily was of the wanton.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But none believed in Moses except some youths from among his people, for the fear of Pharaoh and his elite that he would persecute them. For Pharaoh was indeed a tyrant in the land, and indeed he was an unrestrained [despot].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So none believed Moses except a few of his nation because they feared that Pharaoh and their Council would persecute them. Pharaoh was mighty in theland, and one of the evildoers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But no one believed Moses, except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: No one believed in Moses except some young people of his own tribe who were at the same time very afraid of the persecution of the Pharaoh and his people. The Pharaoh was certainly a tyrant and a transgressor.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But none believed in Musa except the offspring of his people, on account of the fear of Firon and their chiefs, lest he should persecute them; and most surely Firon was lofty in the land; and most surely he was of the extravagant.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But none save a few youths declared their faith in Moses, [while others held back] for fear that Pharaoh and his nobles would persecute them. Pharaoh was high and mighty in the land. And one who transgressed all bounds.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But none believed in Moses except some children of his people, because of the fear of Pharaoh and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and certainly Pharaoh was mighty on the earth and one who transgressed all bounds.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "O my people, if you do believe in God place your trust in Him if you are obedient."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Moses said, 'O my people, if you believe in God, in Him put your trust, if you have surrendered.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Musa said: my people! if ye have been believing in Allah, then on Him rely, if ye are muslims.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Musa (Moses) said: "O my people! If you have believed in Allah, then put your trust in Him if you are Muslims (those who submit to Allah's Will)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said, “O my people, if you have believed in God, then put your trust in Him, if you have submitted.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: 'My people! If you believe in Allah and are truly Muslims then place your reliance on Him alone.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Musa said: "O my people! If you have believed in Allah, then put your trust in Him if you are Muslims."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Moses said: O my people! If ye have believed in Allah then put trust in Him, if ye have indeed surrendered (unto Him)!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Moses said, ‘O my people! If you have faith in Allah, put your trust in Him, if you have submitted [to Him].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said: 'O my nation, if you believe in Allah, put your trust in Him, if you have surrendered (Muslims)'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Moses said, "O my people, if you have believed in Allah, then rely upon Him, if you should be Muslims."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses told his people, "If you have submitted yourselves to God and have faith in Him, put your trust in Him".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Musa said: O my people! if you believe in Allah, then rely on Him (alone) if you submit (to Allah).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said, "O my people; if you believe in God, [and] if you have surrendered yourselves to Him, then in Him alone put your trust."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moses said: "O my people! If ye do (really) believe in Allah, then in Him put your trust if ye submit (your will to His)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And the leaders of Pharaoh's people said to him: "Would you allow Moses and his people to create disorder in the land and discard you and your gods?" He replied: "We shall now slay their sons and spare their women, and subdue them."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, 'Wilt thou leave Moses and his people to work corruption in the land, and leave thee and thy gods?' Said he, 'We shall slaughter their sons and spare their women; surely we are triumphant over them!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the chiefs of the people of Fir'awn said: wilt thou leave alone Musa and his people to act corruptly in the land and to leave alone thee and thy gods! He said: soon we shall slay their sons and let live their women, and we are masters over them.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The chiefs of Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people said: "Will you leave Musa (Moses) and his people to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon you and your gods?" He said: "We will kill their sons, and let live their women, and we have indeed irresistible power over them."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said, “Will you let Moses and his people cause trouble in the land, and forsake you and your gods?” He said, “We will kill their sons, and spare their women. We have absolute power over them.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The elders of Pharaoh's people said: 'Will you leave alone Moses and his people to spread mischief in the land, and forsake you and your gods?' Pharaoh replied: 'We will kill their male children and spare their female ones. For indeed we hold irresistible sway over them.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The chiefs of Fir`awn's people said: "Will you leave Musa and his people to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon you and your gods" He said: "We will kill their sons, and let their women live, and we have indeed irresistible power over them."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said: (O King), wilt thou suffer Moses and his people to make mischief in the land, and flout thee and thy gods? He said: We will slay their sons and spare their women, for lo! we are in power over them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The elite of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land, and to abandon you and your gods?’ He said, ‘We will kill their sons and spare their women, and indeed we are dominant over them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The assembly of Pharaoh's nation said: 'Will you allow Moses and his nation to corrupt in the land and to forsake you and your gods' He replied: 'We will put their sons to death and spare their women, indeed we are conquerors over them'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Some of the Pharaohs people said, "Will you let Moses and his people destroy the land and disregard you and your gods?" The Pharaoh said, "We will kill their sons and leave their women alive; they are under our domination."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the chiefs of Firon's people said: Do you leave Musa and his people to make mischief in the land and to forsake you and your gods? He said: We will slay their sons and spare their women, and surely we are masters over them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said, "Will you allow Moses and his people to spread corruption in the land, and to forsake you and your gods?" He replied, "We shall kill their male children and spare only the females. We have complete power over them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Said Moses to his people: "Invoke the help of God and be firm. The earth belongs to God: He can make whom He wills among His creatures inherit it. The future is theirs who take heed for themselves."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said Moses to his people, 'Pray for succour to God, and be patient; surely the earth is God's and He bequeaths it to whom He will among His servants. The issue ultimate is to the godfearing.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said unto his people: seek help in Allah and persevere; verily the earth is Allah's; He maketh whomsoever He willeth of His bondmen inherit it, and the happy end is of the God-fearing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Musa (Moses) said to his people: "Seek help in Allah and be patient. Verily, the earth is Allah's. He gives it as a heritage to whom He will of His slaves, and the (blessed) end is for the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Moses said to his people, “Seek help in God, and be patient. The earth belongs to God. He gives it in inheritance to whomever He wills of His servants, and the future belongs to the righteous.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said to his people: 'Seek help from Allah and be steadfast. The earth is Allah's, He bestows it on those of His servants He chooses. The end of things belongs to the God-fearing.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Musa said to his people: "Seek help in Allah and be patient. Verily, the earth is Allah's. He gives it as a heritage to whom He wills of His servants; and the (blessed) end is for the pious and righteous persons."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Moses said unto his people: Seek help in Allah and endure. Lo! the earth is Allah's. He giveth it for an inheritance to whom He will. And lo! the sequel is for those who keep their duty (unto Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Moses said to his people, ‘Turn to Allah for help and be patient. The earth indeed belongs to Allah, and He gives its inheritance to whomever He wishes of His servants, and the outcome will be in favour of the Godwary.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Moses said to his nation: 'Seek help from Allah and be patient. The earth belongs to Allah; He gives it as a heritage to whom He chooses amongst His worshipers. The outcome is for the cautious'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allah and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allah. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses told his people to seek help from God and exercise patience. The earth belongs to Him and He has made it the heritage of whichever of His servants He chooses. The final victory is for the pious ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Musa said to his people: Ask help from Allah and be patient; surely the land is Allah's; He causes such of His servants to inherit it as He pleases, and the end is for those who guard (against evil).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses said to his people, "Turn to God for help and be patient. The earth belongs to God. He gives it to those of His servants whom He chooses, and the future belongs to the God-fearing."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Said Moses to his people: "Pray for help from Allah, and (wait) in patience and constancy: for the earth is Allah's, to give as a heritage to such of His servants as He pleaseth; and the end is (best) for the righteous.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "We were oppressed before you came, and have been since you have come to us." He answered: "It may well be that soon God may destroy your enemy and make you inherit the land, and then see how you behave."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We have been hurt before thou camest to us, and after thou camest to us.' He said, 'Perchance your Lord will destroy your enemy, and will make you successors in the land, so that He may behold how you shall do.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: oppressed we have been ere thou camest unto us and since thou hast come unto us. He said: belike your Lord will destroy your enemy and establish yougs in their stead in the land, thathe may see what wise ye act.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "We (Children of Israel) had suffered troubles before you came to us, and since you have come to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you successors on the earth, so that He may see how you act?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We were persecuted before you came to us, and after you came to us.” He said, “Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy, and make you successors in the land; then He will see how you behave.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The people of Moses replied: 'We were oppressed before your coming to us and after it.' Moses said: 'Your Lord will soon destroy your enemy and make you rulers in the land. Then He will see how you act.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We suffered troubles before you came to us, and since you have come to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you successors on the earth, so that He may see how you act"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We suffered hurt before thou camest unto us, and since thou hast come unto us. He said: It may be that your Lord is going to destroy your adversary and make you viceroys in the earth, that He may see how ye behave.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We were tormented before you came to us and [also] after you came to us.’ He said, ‘Maybe your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you successors in the land, and then He will see how you act.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They replied: 'We were hurt before you came to us, and after you came to us' He said: 'Your Lord may destroy your enemies and make you inheritors in the land. Then He will see how you conduct yourselves'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: His people said, "We suffered a great deal before you came and we are still suffering even after you have come." Moses (tried to encourage them) by saying, "There is hope that your Lord will destroy your enemies and make you (their) successors in the land. So consider how you act."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We have been persecuted before you came to us and since you have come to us. He said: It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you rulers in the land, then He will see how you act.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They replied, "We were being persecuted before you came to us, and we are still being persecuted." He said, "Your Lord may well destroy your enemy and make you successors to the land. Then He will see how you conduct yourselves."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble, both before and after thou camest to us." He said: "It may be that your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you inheritors in the earth; that so He may try you by your deeds."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with famine and dearth of everything that they might take heed.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then seized We Pharaoh's people with years of dearth, and scarcity of fruits, that haply they might remember.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We laid hold of the people of Fir'awn with lean years and lack of fruits, that haply they might dread.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We punished the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with years of drought and shortness of fruits (crops, etc.), that they might remember (take heed).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with barren years, and with shortage of crops, that they may take heed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with hard times and with poor harvest that they may heed.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We punished the people of Fir`awn with years of drought and lack of fruits (crops), that they might remember (take heed).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And we straitened Pharaoh's folk with famine and dearth of fruits, that peradventure they might heed.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We afflicted Pharaoh’s clan with droughts and loss of produce, so that they may take admonition.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We seized Pharaoh's people with years of drought and scarcity of fruit so that they might remember.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: For years We afflicted Pharaoh's people with shortages in food so that perhaps they would take heed.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We overtook Firon's people with droughts and diminution of fruits that they may be mindful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We afflicted Pharaoh's people with shortages of food and famine so that they might take heed,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We punished the people of Pharaoh with years (of droughts) and shortness of crops; that they might receive admonition.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Yet when good came their way they said: "It is our due;" but when misfortune befell them they put the omen down to Moses and those who were with him. But surely the omen was with God, yet most of them did not understand.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So, when good came to them, they said, 'This belongs to us'; but if any evil smote them, they would augur ill by Moses and those with him. Why, surely their ill augury was with God; but the most of them knew not.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: So whenever good-hap came unto them, they would say: ours is this. And if a mishap afflicted them, they would lay it to the evil augury of Musa and these with him. Behold! their evil augury was only with Allah, but most of them knew not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: But whenever good came to them, they said: "Ours is this." And if evil afflicted them, they ascribed it to evil omens connected with Musa (Moses) and those with him. Be informed! Verily, their evil omens are with Allah but most of them know not.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When something good came their way, they said, “This is ours.” And when something bad happened to them, they ascribed the evil omen to Moses and those with him. In fact, their omen is with God, but most of them do not know.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But whenever prosperity came their way, they said: 'This is our due.' And whatever hardship befell them, they attributed it to the misfortune of Moses and those who followed him. Surely, their misfortune had been decreed by Allah - but most of them do not know that.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: But whenever good came to them, they said: "This is for us." And if evil afflicted them, they considered it an omen about Musa and those with him. Be informed! Verily, their omens are with Allah but most of them know not.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But whenever good befell them, they said: This is ours; and whenever evil smote them they ascribed it to the evil auspices of Moses and those with him. Surely their evil auspice was only with Allah. But most of them knew not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But whenever any good came to them, they would say, ‘This is our due.’ And if any ill visited them, they took it for ill omens attending Moses and those who were with him. (Look! Indeed the cause of their ill omens is from Allah, but most of them do not know.)

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When good things came their way, they said: 'It is our due' but when evil befell them they blamed their ill fortune on Moses and those with him. Indeed their ill fortune was with Allah, though most of them did not know.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: But they would always ascribe their well-being to themselves and the misfortunes that they would experience to Moses and his people. Their fate is certainly in the hands of God but many of them do not know.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But when good befell them they said: This is due to us; and when evil afflicted them, they attributed it to the ill-luck of Musa and those with him; surely their evil fortune is only from Allah but most of them do not know.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then when something good came to them, they said, "It is our due!" -- but when something bad came, they ascribed it as an ill-omen to Moses and those with him. Surely their [evil] fortune had been decreed by God, but most of them did not know this.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But when good (times) came, they said, "This is due to us;" When gripped by calamity, they ascribed it to evil omens connected with Moses and those with him! Behold! in truth the omens of evil are theirs in Allah's sight, but most of them do not understand!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "Whatsoever the sign you have brought to deceive us, we shall not believe in you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And they said, 'Whatsoever sign thou bringest to us, to cast a spell upon us, we will not believe thee.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And they said: whatsoever thou mayest bring unto us of the nature of a sign wherewith to enchant us, in thee we are not going to be believers

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said [to Musa (Moses)]: "Whatever Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) you may bring to us, to work therewith your sorcery on us, we shall never believe in you."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And they said, “No matter what sign you bring us, to bewitch us with, we will not believe in you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And they said to Moses: 'Whatever sign you might produce before us in order to enchant us, we are not going to believe you.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said [to Musa]: "Whatever Ayat you may bring to us, to work therewith your sorcery on us, we shall never believe in you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they said: Whatever portent thou bringest wherewith to bewitch us, we shall not put faith in thee.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And they said, ‘Whatever sign you may bring us to bewitch us, we are not going to believe you.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Whatever sign you bring to us, to cast a spell upon us, we will not believe in you'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be believers in you."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said to Moses, "No matter what miracle you show to bewitch us, we will not believe you."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And they said: Whatever sign you may bring to us to charm us with it-- we will not believe in you.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Whatever miracles you work to bewitch us, we will not believe in you."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said (to Moses): "Whatever be the Signs thou bringest, to work therewith thy sorcery on us, we shall never believe in thee.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with famine and dearth of everything that they might take heed.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then seized We Pharaoh's people with years of dearth, and scarcity of fruits, that haply they might remember.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We laid hold of the people of Fir'awn with lean years and lack of fruits, that haply they might dread.

translation.text: And indeed We punished the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with years of drought and shortness of fruits (crops, etc.), that they might remember (take heed).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with barren years, and with shortage of crops, that they may take heed.

translation.text: We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with hard times and with poor harvest that they may heed.

translation.text: And indeed We punished the people of Fir`awn with years of drought and lack of fruits (crops), that they might remember (take heed).

translation.text: And we straitened Pharaoh's folk with famine and dearth of fruits, that peradventure they might heed.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We afflicted Pharaoh’s clan with droughts and loss of produce, so that they may take admonition.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We seized Pharaoh's people with years of drought and scarcity of fruit so that they might remember.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: For years We afflicted Pharaoh's people with shortages in food so that perhaps they would take heed.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We overtook Firon's people with droughts and diminution of fruits that they may be mindful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We afflicted Pharaoh's people with shortages of food and famine so that they might take heed,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We punished the people of Pharaoh with years (of droughts) and shortness of crops; that they might receive admonition.

translation.text: Yet when good came their way they said: "It is our due;" but when misfortune befell them they put the omen down to Moses and those who were with him. But surely the omen was with God, yet most of them did not understand.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So, when good came to them, they said, 'This belongs to us'; but if any evil smote them, they would augur ill by Moses and those with him. Why, surely their ill augury was with God; but the most of them knew not.

translation.text: So whenever good-hap came unto them, they would say: ours is this. And if a mishap afflicted them, they would lay it to the evil augury of Musa and these with him. Behold! their evil augury was only with Allah, but most of them knew not.

translation.text: But whenever good came to them, they said: "Ours is this." And if evil afflicted them, they ascribed it to evil omens connected with Musa (Moses) and those with him. Be informed! Verily, their evil omens are with Allah but most of them know not.

translation.text: When something good came their way, they said, “This is ours.” And when something bad happened to them, they ascribed the evil omen to Moses and those with him. In fact, their omen is with God, but most of them do not know.

translation.text: But whenever prosperity came their way, they said: 'This is our due.' And whatever hardship befell them, they attributed it to the misfortune of Moses and those who followed him. Surely, their misfortune had been decreed by Allah - but most of them do not know that.

translation.text: But whenever good came to them, they said: "This is for us." And if evil afflicted them, they considered it an omen about Musa and those with him. Be informed! Verily, their omens are with Allah but most of them know not.

translation.text: But whenever good befell them, they said: This is ours; and whenever evil smote them they ascribed it to the evil auspices of Moses and those with him. Surely their evil auspice was only with Allah. But most of them knew not.

translation.text: But whenever any good came to them, they would say, ‘This is our due.’ And if any ill visited them, they took it for ill omens attending Moses and those who were with him. (Look! Indeed the cause of their ill omens is from Allah, but most of them do not know.)

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When good things came their way, they said: 'It is our due' but when evil befell them they blamed their ill fortune on Moses and those with him. Indeed their ill fortune was with Allah, though most of them did not know.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.

translation.text: But they would always ascribe their well-being to themselves and the misfortunes that they would experience to Moses and his people. Their fate is certainly in the hands of God but many of them do not know.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But when good befell them they said: This is due to us; and when evil afflicted them, they attributed it to the ill-luck of Musa and those with him; surely their evil fortune is only from Allah but most of them do not know.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then when something good came to them, they said, "It is our due!" -- but when something bad came, they ascribed it as an ill-omen to Moses and those with him. Surely their [evil] fortune had been decreed by God, but most of them did not know this.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But when good (times) came, they said, "This is due to us;" When gripped by calamity, they ascribed it to evil omens connected with Moses and those with him! Behold! in truth the omens of evil are theirs in Allah's sight, but most of them do not understand!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Yet when punishment overtook them, they said: "O Moses, invoke your Lord for us as you have been enjoined. If the torment is removed, we shall certainly believe in you and let the people of Israel go with you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when the wrath fell upon them, they said, 'Moses, pray to thy Lord for us by the covenant He has made with thee. If thou removest from us the wrath, surely we will believe thee, and send forth with thee the Children of Israel.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And whensoever a plague fell on them, they said: O Musa! supplicate thy Lord for us, by that which He hath covenanted with thee; surely if thou remove the plague from us we will surely believe in thee, and we will send away with thee the Children of Israi'l.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when the punishment fell on them they said: "O Musa (Moses)! Invoke your Lord for us because of His Promise to you. If you will remove the punishment from us, we indeed shall believe in you, and we shall let the Children of Israel go with you."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Whenever a plague befell them, they would say, “O Moses, pray to your Lord for us, according to the covenant He made with you. If you lift the plague from us, we will believe in you, and let the Children of Israel go with you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Each time a scourge struck them they, said: 'O Moses! Pray for us to your Lord on the strength of the prophethood He has bestowed upon you. Surely, if you remove this scourge from us, we will truly believe in you, and will let the Children of Israel go with you.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when the punishment struck them, they said: "O Musa! Invoke your Lord for us because of His promise to you. If you remove the punishment from us, we indeed shall believe in you, and we shall let the Children of Israel go with you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the terror fell on them they cried: O Moses! Pray for us unto thy Lord, because He hath a covenant with thee. If thou removest the terror from us we verily will trust thee and will let the Children of Israel go with thee.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Whenever a plague fell upon them, they would say, ‘O Moses, invoke your Lord for us by the covenant He has made with you. If you remove the plague from us, we will certainly believe in you and let the Children of Israel go along with you.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the plague smote them, they said: 'Moses, pray to your Lord for us invoking the promise He has made with you. If you lift the plague from us, we will believe in you and let the Children of Israel go with you'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the torment would strike them, they would ask Moses, "Pray for us to your Lord through your covenant with Him. If He saves us from the torment, we shall certainly believe in you and permit you and the children of Israel to leave".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when the plague fell upon them, they said: O Musa! pray for us to your Lord as He has promised with you, if you remove the plague from us, we will certainly believe in you and we will certainly send away with you the children of Israel.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Whenever a plague struck them, they would say, "Moses, pray to your Lord for us by virtue of the promise He has made to you: if you remove this plague from us, we will surely believe in you and let the Children of Israel go with you,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Every time the penalty fell on them, they said: "O Moses! on your behalf call on thy Lord in virtue of his promise to thee: If thou wilt remove the penalty from us, we shall truly believe in thee, and we shall send away the Children of Israel with thee."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But they said: "O sorcerer, call on your Lord for us in accordance with the compact He has made with you. We shall certainly come to guidance."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And they said, 'Sorcerer, pray to thy Lord for us by the covenant He has made with thee, and surely we shall be right-guided.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And they said: magician! supplicate thy Lord for us for that which He hath covenanted with thee; verily we shall let ourselves be guided.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And they said [to Musa (Moses)]: "O you sorcerer! Invoke your Lord for us according to what He has covenanted with you. Verily, We shall guide ourselves (aright)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O sorcerer, pray to your Lord for us, according to His pledge to you, and then we will be guided.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (Whenever they faced an affliction) they would say: “O magician, pray for us to your Lord according to your station with Him. We shall certainly be guided to the Right Way.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And they said (to Musa): "O you sorcerer! Invoke your Lord for us according to what He has made a pact with you. Verily, We shall guide ourselves."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they said: O wizard! Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that He hath made with thee. Lo! we verily will walk aright.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They would say, ‘O magician! Invoke your Lord for us by the covenant He has made with you [to remove this scourge]. We will indeed be guided [when it is removed].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Sorcerer' they said, 'pray to your Lord for us in accordance to the covenant He has made with you, and surely we shall be rightly guided'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And they said [to Moses], "O magician, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. Indeed, we will be guided."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "Magician, pray to your Lord for us through your covenant with Him (If he saves us from the torment), we shall certainly seek guidance".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And they said: O magician! call on your Lord for our sake, as He has made the covenant with you; we shall surely be the followers of the right way.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Sorcerer, call on your Lord for us, by virtue of His pledge to you: we shall certainly accept guidance,"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And they said, "O thou sorcerer! Invoke thy Lord for us according to His covenant with thee; for we shall truly accept guidance."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Thus he made light (of the matter) to his people, and they obeyed him. They were certainly wicked.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So he made his people unsteady, and they obeyed him; surely they were an ungodly people.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he incited his people and they obeyed him; verily they were ever a transgressing people.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Thus he [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] befooled and misled his people, and they obeyed him. Verily, they were ever a people who were Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him. They were wicked people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He incited his people to levity and they obeyed him. Surely they were an iniquitous people.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him. Verily, they were ever a people who were rebellious.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him. Lo! they were a wanton folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thus did he mislead his people and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were a transgressing lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He (Pharaoh) intimidated his nation, so they obeyed him, for they were a sinning nation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of Allah].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Thus, he made dimwits out of his people and they followed him. They, certainly, were a sinful people. When they invoked Our anger,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he incited his people to levity and they obeyed him: surely they were a transgressing people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: In this way he fooled his people and they obeyed him: they were a rebellious people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Thus did he make fools of his people, and they obeyed him: truly were they a people rebellious (against Allah).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And they denied them out of malice and pride, though in their hearts they believed that they were true. So see how was the end of evil-doers!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, wrongfully and out of pride. Behold, how was the end of the workers of corruption!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And they gainsaid them, out of spite and arrogance, although their souls were convinced thereof. So behold! what hath been the end of the corruptors.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And they belied them (those Ayat) wrongfully and arrogantly, though their ownselves were convinced thereof [i.e. those (Ayat) are from Allah, and Musa (Moses) is the Messenger of Allah in truth, but they disliked to obey Musa (Moses), and hated to believe in his Message of Monotheism]. So see what was the end of the Mufsidun (disbelievers, disobedient to Allah, evil-doers, liars.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And they rejected them, although their souls were certain of them, out of wickedness and pride. So see how the outcome was for the mischief-makers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They denied those Signs out of iniquity and arrogance although their hearts were convinced of their truth. So see how evil was the end of those mischief-makers!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And they belied them wrongfully and arrogantly, though they themselves were convinced thereof. So, see what was the end of the mischief-makers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, for spite and arrogance. Then see the nature of the consequence for the wrong-doers!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They impugned them, wrongfully and out of arrogance, though they were convinced in their hearts [of their veracity]. So observe how the fate of the agents of corruption was!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They denied them unjustly out of pride, though their souls acknowledged them. See, how was the end of the corrupt workers!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They rejected the evidence because of their arrogance and injustice, although their souls knew it to be true. Think how terrible the end of the sinful ones was!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And they denied them unjustly and proudly while their soul had been convinced of them; consider, then how was the end of the mischief-makers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And they persisted in rejecting them wrongfully and arrogantly, while in their hearts they were convinced of their truth. Observe, then, how evil was the fate of the evil-doers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And they rejected those Signs in iniquity and arrogance, though their souls were convinced thereof: so see what was the end of those who acted corruptly!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had tried the people of Pharaoh before them. A respected prophet had come to them (saying):

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Already before them We tried the people of Pharaoh, and a noble Messenger came unto them,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly afore them We proved Fir'awn's people, and there came Unto them an apostle honoured.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We tried before them Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people, when there came to them a noble Messenger [i.e. Musa (Moses)],

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Before them We tested the people of Pharaoh; a noble messenger came to them.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed before that We subjected the Pharaonites to the same test. A noble Messenger came to them

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We tried before them Fir`awn's people, when there came to them a noble Messenger.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We tried before them Pharaoh's folk, when there came unto them a noble messenger,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We tried the people of Pharaoh before them, when a noble apostle came to them,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We tried Pharaoh's nation before them. A noble Messenger came to them,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had certainly tested the people of the Pharaoh before them to whom a noble Messengers had come, saying,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We tried before them the people of Firon, and there came to them a noble apostle,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We tried the people of Pharaoh before them: a noble messenger was sent to them,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did, before them, try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them a messenger most honourable,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We commanded Moses and his brother: "Build homes for your people in Egypt, and make your houses places of worship, perform your acts of prayer and give happy tidings to those who believe."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And We sent the divine revelation to Moosa and his brother that, “Build houses for your people in Egypt and make your houses as places of worship, and keep the prayer established, and give glad tidings to the Muslims.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We revealed to Moses and his brother, 'Take you, for your people, in Egypt certain houses; and make your houses a direction for men to pray to; and perform the prayer; and do thou give good tidings to the believers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We Revealed unto Musa and his brother: inhabit houses for your people in Misr, and make your houses a place of Worship, and establish prayer, and give glad tidings to the believers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We inspired Musa (Moses) and his brother (saying): "Take dwellings for your people in Egypt, and make your dwellings as places for your worship, and perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and give glad tidings to the believers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We inspired Moses and his brother, “Settle your people in Egypt, and make your homes places of worship, and perform the prayer, and give good news to the believers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We directed Moses and his brother: 'Prepare a few houses for your people in Egypt, and make your houses a direction for men to pray, and establish Prayer, and give glad tidings to the men of faith.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We revealed to Musa and his brother (saying): "Provide dwellings for your people in Egypt, and make your dwellings as places for your worship, and perform the Salah, and give glad tidings to the believers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We inspired Moses and his brother, (saying): Appoint houses for your people in Egypt and make your houses oratories, and establish worship. And give good news to the believers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We revealed to Moses and his brother [saying], ‘Settle your people in the city, and let your houses face each other, and maintain the prayer, and give good news to the faithful.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We revealed to Moses and his brother: 'Take certain houses for your people in Egypt. Make your houses a direction (for pray); establish the prayer; and give glad tidings to the believers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [facing the] qiblah and establish prayer and give good tidings to the believers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent a revelation to Moses and his brother to build houses for their people in the Pharaoh's town and to build them facing one another. (We told him) that therein they should pray and that Moses should give the glad news (of God's mercy) to the faithful ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We revealed to Musa and his brother, saying: Take for your people houses to abide in Egypt and make your houses places of worship and keep up prayer and give good news to the believers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We revealed [Our will] to Moses and his brother, saying, "Set aside for your people some houses in the city and turn them into places of worship, and be constant in prayer! And give [O Moses] the good news to the believers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We inspired Moses and his brother with this Message: "Provide dwellings for your people in Egypt, make your dwellings into places of worship, and establish regular prayers: and give glad tidings to those who believe!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We commanded Moses: "Journey by night with Our creatures, and strike a dry path for them through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, nor have dread of any thing."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Also We revealed unto Moses, 'Go with My servants by night; strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not overtaking, neither afraid.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We revealed unto Musa, saying: depart in night with my bondmen, and make for them in the sea a parth dry: thou Shalt fear neither overtaking, nor shalt thou be afraid.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Travel by night with Ibadi (My slaves) and strike a dry path for them in the sea, fearing neither to be overtaken [by Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] nor being afraid (of drowning in the sea)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We inspired Moses: “Travel by night with My servants, and strike for them a dry path across the sea, not fearing being overtaken, nor worrying.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Most certainly We revealed to Moses: "Proceed with My servants in the night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be afraid of treading through the sea."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We revealed to Musa: "Travel by night with My servants and strike a dry path for them in the sea, fearing neither to be overtaken nor being afraid."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not to be overtaken, neither being afraid (of the sea).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We revealed to Moses, [saying], ‘Set out with My servants at night, and strike out for them a dry path through the sea. Do not be afraid of being overtaken, and have no fear [of getting drowned].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: To Moses we also revealed: 'Set forth with My worshipers by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Do not fear that you will be overtaken, neither be afraid'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent revelations to Moses telling him, "Travel with My servants during the night and strike a dry road across the sea (for them). Have no fear of being overtaken (by the Pharaoh) nor of anything else".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We revealed to Musa, saying: Travel by night with My servants, then make for them a dry path in the sea, not fearing to be overtaken, nor being afraid.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent a revelation to Moses saying, "Take away My servants by night and strike for them a dry path through the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken and do not be afraid."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with My servants, and strike a dry path for them through the sea, without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We said to Moses: "Travel by night with My creatures. You will surely be pursued."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Also We revealed unto Moses, 'Go with My servants by night; surely you will be followed.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We revealed unto Musa saying: go by night with My bondmen verily ye shall be pursued.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We inspired Musa (Moses), saying: "Take away My slaves by night, verily, you will be pursued."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We inspired Moses: “Travel with My servants by night. You will be followed.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We revealed to Moses: "Set forth with My servants by night for you will be pursued."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We revealed to Musa, saying: "Depart by night with My servants, verily, you will be pursued."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night, for ye will be pursued.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses, [saying],‘Set out with My servants at night, for you will be pursued.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Also, We revealed to Moses, saying: 'Go with My worshipers by night, for you will be followed'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We hope that our Lord will forgive us for our sins; we were not believers at first."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We revealed to Musa, saying: Go away with My servants travelling by night, surely you will be pursued.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We revealed Our will to Moses, saying, "Set forth with My servants, in the night, for you will surely be pursued."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: By inspiration we told Moses: "Travel by night with my servants; for surely ye shall be pursued."
