translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities musterers:

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then Fir'awn sent unto the cities callers:

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then Fir'aun (Pharaoh) sent callers to (all) the cities.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities (to mobilise troops)

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then Fir`awn sent callers to (all) the cities.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent gatherers to the cities.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent a revelation to Moses telling him to leave with our servants during the night; they would be pursued (by the Pharaoh).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So Firon sent heralds into the cities;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And Pharaoh sent forth heralds to all the cities.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Behold, these are a small troop,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily these are but a band small.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (Saying): "Verily! These indeed are but a small band.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “These are a small gang.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: saying: "These (Israelites) are only a small band of people

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Saying): "Verily, these indeed are but a small band."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Who said): Lo! these indeed are but a little troop,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [proclaiming:] ‘These are indeed a small band.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'These' they said, 'are a small band,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh sent word to all the cities saying,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Most surely these are a small company;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "These," they said, "are only a small band,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then they followed them at the sunrise;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: At sunrise they set off in pursuit of them

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So, they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they overtook them at sunrise.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: At sunrise, they followed them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Thus we let the Israelites inherit them all.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh and his people pursued them at sunrise,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and, when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, 'We are overtaken!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when the two parties saw each other, the companions of Musa said: verily we are overtaken.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa (Moses) said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When the two groups sighted each other, the followers of Moses said, “We are being overtaken.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, ‘Indeed we have been caught up.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the two hosts came in view of each other, Moses' companions said: 'We have been reached'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The people of the Pharaoh pursued them at sunrise.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa cried out: Most surely we are being overtaken.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and when the two groups saw each other, Moses' companions said, "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'No indeed; surely my Lord is with me; He will guide me.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Musa said: by no means; verily with me is my Lord; He shall guide me.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily! With me is my Lord, He will guide me."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “No; my Lord is with me, He will guide me.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Musa) said: "Nay, verily with me is my Lord. He will guide me."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Certainly not! Indeed my Lord is with me. He will guide me.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'No, indeed' he replied, 'my Lord is with me and He will guide me'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the two groups came close to each other, the companions of Moses said, "We will be caught".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: By no means; surely my Lord is with me: He will show me a way out.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Moses replied, "No, My Lord is with me, and He will guide me."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses, 'Strike with thy staff the sea'; and it clave, and each part was as a mighty mount.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We revealed unto Musa, saying: smite thou the sea with thy staff. So it became separated, and each part was like unto a cliff mighty.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part (of that sea water) became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff.” Whereupon it parted, and each part was like a huge hill.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We revealed to Musa (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part became like huge mountain.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff!’ Whereupon it parted, and each part was as if it were a great mountain.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then We revealed to Moses: 'Strike the sea with your staff', so it divided and each part was as a mighty mount.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses said, "Certainly not. My Lord is with me and He will certainly guide me."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then We revealed to Musa: Strike the sea with your staff. So it had cloven asunder, and each part was like a huge mound.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We bade Moses strike the sea with his staff. And it parted, and each part was like a huge mountain.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod." So it divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he called to his Lord: "These are a sinful people."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And he called to his Lord, saying, 'These are a sinful people.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he called upon his Lord. these are a people guilty.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (But they were aggressive), so he [Musa (Moses)] called upon his Lord (saying): "These are indeed the people who are Mujrimun (disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, criminals, etc.)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He appealed to his Lord: “These are a sinful people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then he called upon his Lord: “These are a criminal people.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So he (Musa) called upon his Lord (saying): "These are indeed the people who are criminals."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And he cried unto his Lord, (saying): These are guilty folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then he invoked his Lord, [saying,] ‘These are indeed a guilty lot.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then he supplicated to his Lord saying: 'These are sinful people'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [finally] he called to his Lord that these were a criminal people.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Moses addressed his Lord, saying, "Lord, these people are sinners".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then he called upon his Lord: These are a guilty people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then he cried out to his Lord, "These are sinful people."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (But they were aggressive:) then he cried to his Lord: "These are indeed a people given to sin."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then the Pharaoh followed them with his army, but the sea overpowered and engulfed them.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Pharaoh followed them with his hosts, but they were overwhelmed by the sea;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then Fir'awn followed them with his hosts; and there came upon them of the sea that which came upon them.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then Fir'aun (Pharaoh) pursued them with his hosts, but the sea-water completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh pursued them with his troops, but the sea overwhelmed them, and completely engulfed them.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, but they were fully overwhelmed by the sea.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then Fir`awn pursued them with his hosts, but the sea [Al-Yamm] completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then Pharaoh followed them with his hosts and there covered them that which did cover them of the sea.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his troops, whereat they were engulfed by what engulfed them of the sea.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh pursued them with his legions so they were overwhelmed from the sea with that which drowned them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh and his army chased Moses and his people but were drowned by the sea.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon followed them with his armies, so there came upon them of the sea that which came upon them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, but they were submerged by the sea, which was destined to overwhelm them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces, but the waters completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: so Pharaoh had led his people astray, and was no guide to them.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Fir'awn led his nation astray, and guided them not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) led his people astray, and he did not guide them.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Pharaoh misled his people, and did not guide them.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh led his people astray; he did not guide them aright.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Fir`awn led his people astray, and he did not guide them.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Pharaoh led his folk astray, he did not guide them.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide them.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: For Pharaoh had misled his nation, and did not guide them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh and his people had gone away from guidance.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Firon led astray his people and he did not guide (them) aright.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: For Pharaoh had led his people astray and did not guide them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then We brought the others to that place.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And there We brought the others on,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We brought near thither the others.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We brought near the others [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) party] to that place.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And there We brought the others near.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We also brought the other party close to the same spot,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We brought near the others to that place.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then brought We near the others to that place.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: There, We brought the others near,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And there We brought the others on,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent a revelation to Moses saying, "Strike the sea with your staff." The sea was rent asunder and each side stood high up like a huge mountain.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We brought near, there, the others.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: In the meantime We made the others approach that place.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We made the other party approach thither.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We delivered Moses and every one with him,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and We delivered Moses and those with him all together;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We delivered Musa and those with him together.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We saved Musa (Moses) and all those with him.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and We delivered Moses and his companions, all of them,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We saved Musa and all those with him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We saved Moses and those with him, every one;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and We delivered Moses and all those who were with him.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and We saved Moses and those who were with him together,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then We brought the two parties closer.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We saved Musa and those with him, all of them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We delivered Moses and all those who were with him,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We delivered Moses and all who were with him;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We drowned the others.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We drowned the others.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then We drowned the rest.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: then, We drowned the others.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We saved Moses and all the people with him

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then We drowned the others.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But We drowned the others.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We brought the people of Israel across the sea, but the Pharaoh and his army pursued them wickedly and maliciously till he was on the point of drowning, and he said: "I believe that there is no god but He in whom the people of Israel believe, and I submit to Him."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea; and Pharaoh and his hosts followed them insolently and impetuously till, when the drowning overtook him, he said, 'I believe that there is no god but He in whom the Children of Israel believe; I am of those that surrender.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We led the Children of Isra'il across the sea; then Fir'awn and his hosts pursued them in rebellion and enmity, until, when the drowning over-took him, he said: I believe that verily He! there is no god but he, in whom the Children of Isra'il believe, and am of the Muslims.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with his hosts followed them in oppression and enmity, till when drowning overtook him, he said: "I believe that La ilaha illa (Huwa): (none has the right to be worshipped but) He," in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of the Muslims (those who submit to Allah's Will)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We delivered the Children of Israel across the sea. Pharaoh and his troops pursued them, defiantly and aggressively. Until, when he was about to drown, he said, “I believe that there is no god except the One the Children of Israel believe in, and I am of those who submit.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We led the Children of Israel across the sea. Then Pharaoh and his hosts pursued them in iniquity and transgression until Pharaoh cried out while he was drowning: 'I believe that there is no god but Allah in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am also one of those who submit to Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Fir`awn with his hosts followed them in oppression and enmity, till when drowning overtook him, he (Fira`wn) said: "I believe that none has the right to be worshipped but He in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of the Muslims."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We brought the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh with his hosts pursued them in rebellion and transgression, till, when the (fate of) drowning overtook him, he exclaimed: I believe that there is no Allah save Him in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of those who surrender (unto Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We carried the Children of Israel across the sea, whereat Pharaoh and his troops pursued them, out of defiance and aggression. When overtaken by drowning, he called out, ‘I believe that there is no god except Him in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of those who submit [to Him]!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We brought the Children of Israel through the sea, and Pharaoh and his legions pursued them arrogantly and frantically. But as he was drowning he cried out: '(Now) I believe that there is no god except He in whom the Children of Israel believe. I am of those that surrender (Muslims)'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We helped the children of Israel cross the sea safely. The Pharaoh and his army pursued the children of Israel with wickedness and hate until the Pharaoh was drowned. As he was drowning the Pharaoh said, "I declare that there is no God but the One in whom the children of Israel believe and I have submitted to the Word of God".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We made the children of Israel to pass through the sea, then Firon and his hosts followed them for oppression and tyranny; until when drowning overtook him, he said: I believe that there is no god but He in Whom the children of Israel believe and I am of those who submit.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So We brought the Children of Israel across the sea. Pharaoh and his troops pursued them arrogantly and aggressively. When he was about to drown, [Pharaoh] exclaimed, "I believe that there is no deity save Him in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of those who surrender themselves to Him!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We took the Children of Israel across the sea: Pharaoh and his hosts followed them in insolence and spite. At length, when overwhelmed with the flood, he said: "I believe that there is no god except Him Whom the Children of Israel believe in: I am of those who submit (to Allah in Islam)."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember, We parted the sea and saved you, and drowned the men of Pharaoh before your very eyes.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We divided for you the sea and delivered you, and drowned Pharaoh's folk while you were beholding.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We separated the sea for you and delivered you and drowned Fir'awn's house while ye looked on.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We separated the sea for you and saved you and drowned Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people while you were looking (at them, when the sea-water covered them).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And recall that We parted the sea for you, so We saved you, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh as you looked on.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Remember the time when We parted the sea to make way for you and let you pass safely through it and then drowned Pharaoh's people before your very eyes.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We separated the sea for you and saved you and drowned Fir`awn's (Pharaoh) people while you were watching.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We brought you through the sea and rescued you, and drowned the folk of Pharaoh in your sight.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when We parted the sea with you, and We delivered you and drowned Pharaoh’s clan as you looked on.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We parted the sea for you, and, taking you to safety, drowned the family of Pharaoh before your eyes.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [recall] when We parted the sea for you and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We parted the sea to save you and drowned Pharaoh's people before your very eyes.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We parted the sea for you, so We saved you and drowned the followers of Firon and you watched by.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and when We divided the sea for you and saved you and drowned Pharaoh's people, while you looked on.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember We divided the sea for you and saved you and drowned Pharaoh's people within your very sight.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He and his soldiers had become arrogant in the land for no reason, and did not think that they have to come back to Us in the end.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And he waxed proud in the land, he and his hosts, wrongfully; and they thought they should not be returned to Us.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And he and his hosts were stiff-necked in the land without right, and imagined that before Us they would not be brought back.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And he and his hosts were arrogant in the land, without right, and they thought that they would never return to Us.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He and his troops acted arrogantly in the land, with no justification. They thought they would not be returned to Us.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And he and his hosts waxed arrogant in the land without any right, believing that they will never have to return to Us!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And he and his armies were arrogant in the land, without right, and they thought that they would never return to Us.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And he and his hosts were haughty in the land without right, and deemed that they would never be brought back to Us.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He and his hosts unduly acted arrogantly in the land, and thought they would not be brought back to Us.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He and his hosts became wrongfully proud in the land and they thought that they would never be returned to Us.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh and his army were puffed-up with pride in the land for no true cause. They thought that they would never return to Us.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And he was unjustly proud in the land, he and his hosts, and they deemed that they would not be brought back to Us.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He and his hosts behaved arrogantly in the land without any justification, thinking that they would not be recalled to Us,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And he was arrogant and insolent in the land, beyond reason,- He and his hosts: they thought that they would not have to return to Us!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We seized him and his hordes and threw them into the sea. Behold then how was the end of the wicked!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Therefore We seized him and his hosts, and cast their into the sea; so behold how was the end of the evildoers!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Wherefore We laid hold of him and his hosts and cast them into the sea. So behold thou what like hath been the end of the wrong- doers!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts, and We threw them all into the sea (and drowned them). So behold (O Muhammad SAW) what was the end of the Zalimun [wrong-doers, polytheists and those who disbelieved in the Oneness of their Lord (Allah), or rejected the advice of His Messenger Musa (Moses)].

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So We seized him, and his troops, and We threw them into the sea. Observe, therefore, what was the end of the oppressors.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Eventually We seized him and his hosts and We flung them into the sea. So do see the end of the wrong-doers!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So, We seized him and his armies, and We threw them all into the sea. So, behold what was the end of the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Therefor We seized him and his hosts, and abandoned them unto the sea. Behold the nature of the consequence for evil-doers!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts, and threw them into the sea. So observe how was the fate of the wrongdoers!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Therefore, We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea. See how was the end of the harmdoers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sized him and his army and threw them into the sea. See how terrible was the end of the unjust people!

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So We caught hold of him and his hosts, then We cast them into the sea, and see how was the end of the unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: so We seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea. Consider the fate of the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts, and We flung them into the sea: Now behold what was the end of those who did wrong!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then he sought to turn them out of the land, but We drowned him and all his followers.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He desired to startle them from the land; and We drowned him and those with him, all together.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he besought to unsettle them from the land; wherefore We drowned him and those with him, all together.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So he resolved to turn them out of the land (of Egypt). But We drowned him and all who were with him.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He resolved to scare them off the land, but We drowned him, and those with him, altogether.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: At last Pharaoh decided to uproot Moses and the Children of Israel from the land, but We drowned him together with all who were with him;

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So he resolved to turn them out of the land. But We drowned him and all who were with him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And he wished to scare them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him, all together.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He desired to exterminate them from the land, so We drowned him and all those who were with him.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Pharaoh sought to provoke them so that they would leave the land, but We drowned him, together with all who were with him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh wanted to expel the Israelites from the land so We drowned him and all who were with him.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So he desired to destroy them out of the earth, but We drowned him and those with him all together;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So he resolved to scare them out of the land: but We drowned him along with all those who were with him.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So he resolved to remove them from the face of the earth: but We did drown him and all who were with him.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: As (there was) in Moses when We sent him to the Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And also in Moses, when We sent him unto Pharaoh, with a clear authority,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And in Musa also was a lesson, when We sent him Unto Fir'awn with authority manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And in Musa (Moses) (too, there is a sign). When We sent him to Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with a manifest authority.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And in Moses. We sent him to Pharaoh with a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: There is also a Sign for you in the story of Moses when We sent him with a clear authority to Pharaoh.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And in Musa, when We sent him to Fir`awn with a manifest authority.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And in Moses (too, there is a portent) when We sent him unto Pharaoh with clear warrant,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And in Moses [too there is a sign] when We sent him to Pharaoh with a manifest authority.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: In Moses, too, (there were signs). We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: There is also evidence (of the Truth) in the story of Moses when We sent him to the Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And in Musa: When We sent him to Firon with clear authority.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: There is another sign in Moses: We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But he turned to his counsellors, and said: "He is a magician or lunatic."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: but he turned his back, with his court, saying, 'A sorcerer, or a man possessed!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then he turned away with his court, and said: a magician or a madman.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: But [Fir'aun (Pharaoh)] turned away (from Belief in might) along with his hosts, and said: "A sorcerer, or a madman."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But he turned away with his warlords, and said, “A sorcerer or a madman.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But Pharaoh turned away, showing arrogance on account of his power, and said (about Moses): “He is either a sorcerer or a madman.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: But (he) turned away along with his hosts, and said: "A sorcerer or a madman."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But he withdrew (confiding) in his might, and said: A wizard or a madman.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But he turned away assured of his might, and said, ‘A magician or a crazy man!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: but he turned his back with his Assembly, saying: 'He is (either) a sorcerer or a mad man'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But he turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh and his forces turned away from him, saying, "He is either a magician or an insane person".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But he turned away with his forces and said: A magician or a mad man.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But he turned his back, he and his courtiers, and said, "This is a sorcerer or a madman."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "A sorcerer, or one possessed!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We seized him and his armies, and threw them into the sea, for he was worthy of blame.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts, and We cast them into the sea, and he blameworthy.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We laid hold of him and his hosts and flung them into the sea, and he was reproachable.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So We took him and his hosts, and dumped them into the sea, while he was to be blamed.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So We seized him and his troops, and threw them into the sea, and He was to blame.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea. He became an object of much blame.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So We took him and his armies, and dumped them into the sea (Yamm), for he was blameworthy.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts and flung them in the sea, for he was reprobate.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea, while he was blameworthy.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea. Indeed, he was blameworthy.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We seized him and his army and threw them into the sea. He himself was to be blamed.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So We seized him and his hosts and hurled them into the sea and he was blamable.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We seized him and his army and cast them all into the sea: he himself [Pharaoh] was to blame.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; and his was the blame.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They left how many gardens and fountains,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They left - how many! - of gardens and springs.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: How many of gardens and springs do they [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people] left.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: How many gardens did they leave behind, and how many fountains

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: How many of gardens and springs that they (Fir`awn's people) left behind,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: How many were the gardens and the watersprings that they left behind,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: How many gardens and springs did they leave behind!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: How much they left behind of gardens and springs

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: How many were the gardens, springs,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: How many of the gardens and fountains have they left!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: How many gardens and fountains they left behind them,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: How many were the gardens and springs they left behind,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Thus it was; and We passed them on to another people.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Even so; and We bequeathed them upon another people.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Even so And We caused to inherit them another people.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Thus (it was)! And We made other people inherit them (i.e. We made the Children of Israel to inherit the kingdom of Egypt).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So it was; and We passed it on to another people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thus it was; and We made another people inherit all that.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Thus (it was)! And We made other people inherit them.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Even so (it was), and We made it an inheritance for other folk;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So it was; and We bequeathed them to another people.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: As such (it was). And We made other people inherit them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave these as an inheritance to other people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Thus (it was), and We gave them as a heritage to another people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Such was their end, and what had been theirs We gave to other people to inherit.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those things)!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So God preserved him from the evil they were planning; and a dreadful doom encompassed the people of Pharaoh:

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So God guarded him against the evil things of their devising, and there encompassed the folk of Pharaoh the evil chastisement,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Wherefore Allah protected him from ills which they plotted, and there surrounded the family of Fir'awn the evil of torment.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So Allah saved him from the evils that they plotted (against him), while an evil torment encompassed Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So God protected him from the evils of their scheming, while a terrible torment besieged Pharaoh’s clan.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Eventually Allah saved the person endowed with faith from all the evils of their guile, and a woeful chastisement encompassed the Pharaonites.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So, Allah saved him from the evils that they plotted (against him), while an evil torment encompassed Fir`awn's people.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: So Allah warded off from him the evils which they plotted, while a dreadful doom encompassed Pharaoh's folk,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then Allah saved him from their evil schemes, while a terrible punishment besieged Pharaoh’s clan:

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Allah saved him from the evils that they devised, and an evil punishment encompassed Pharaoh's people.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So Allah protected him from the evils they plotted, and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst of punishment -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God protected him against their evil plans and the people of the Pharaoh were struck by the most horrible torment.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So Allah protected him from the evil (consequences) of what they planned, and the most evil punishment overtook Firon's people:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Thus, God delivered him from the evils which they plotted, and the companions of Pharaoh themselves were encompassed by a dreadful scourge;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then Allah saved him from (every) ill that they plotted (against him), but the burnt of the Penalty encompassed on all sides the People of Pharaoh.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. The day the Hour is proclaimed (it will be said:) "Admit the people of Pharaoh to the severest punishment,"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: the Fire, to which they shall be exposed morning and evening; and on the day when the Hour is come: 'Admit the folk of Pharaoh into the most terrible chastisement!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: The Fire! They are exposed thereto morning and evening. And on the Day whereon the Hour will uprise, it will be said: cause the family of Fir'awn to enter the most grievous torment.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The Fire; they are exposed to it, morning and afternoon, and on the Day when the Hour will be established (it will be said to the angels): "Cause Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people to enter the severest torment!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The Fire. They will be exposed to it morning and evening. And on the Day the Hour takes place: “Admit the clan of Pharaoh to the most intense agony.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They are exposed to the Fire every morning and evening; and when the Last Hour will come to pass, a command shall be given: “Admit the Pharaonites to an even more severe chastisement.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The Fire, they are exposed to it, morning and afternoon. And on the Day when the Hour will be established (it will be said to the angels): "Admit Fir`awn's people into the severest torment!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The Fire; they are exposed to it morning and evening; and on the day when the Hour upriseth (it is said): Cause Pharaoh's folk to enter the most awful doom.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: the Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. On the day when the Hour sets in, Pharaoh’s clan will enter the severest punishment.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Before) the Fire they shall be exposed morning and evening, and on the Day when the Hour comes, (it will be said): 'Admit the family of Pharaoh into the most terrible punishment'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The Fire, they are exposed to it morning and evening. And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said], "Make the people of Pharaoh enter the severest punishment."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They will be exposed to the fire in the mornings and the evenings and on the Day of Judgment, they will be told, "People of the Pharaoh, suffer the most severe torment."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: The fire; they shall be brought before it (every) morning and evening and on the day when the hour shall come to pass: Make Firon's people enter the severest chastisement.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: they will be brought before the Fire morning and evening. On the Day the Hour comes, [a voice will cry], "Mete out to Pharaoh's people the harshest punishment!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: In front of the Fire will they be brought, morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We then made the people who were weak (and oppressed) successors of the land to the East and the West which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the children of Israel was fulfilled, for they were patient in adversity; and whatsoever the Pharaoh and his people had fashioned, and the structures they had raised, were destroyed.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We bequeathed upon the people that were abased all the east and the west of the land We had blessed; and perfectly was fulfilled the most fair word of thy Lord upon the Children of Israel, for that they endured patiently; and We destroyed utterly the works of Pharaoh and his people, and what they had been building.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern parts of the land, and the western parts thereof, which We had blest. And fulfilled was the good word of thy Lord unto the Children of Isra'il' for they were long-suffering, and We destroyed that which Fir'awn and his people had builded and that which they had raised.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We made the people who were considered weak to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We have blessed. And the fair Word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because of their endurance. And We destroyed completely all the great works and buildings which Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his people erected.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We made the oppressed people inherit the eastern and western parts of the land, which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the Children of Israel was fulfilled, because of their endurance. And We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had built, and what they had harvested.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We made those who had been persecuted inherit the eastern and western lands which We had blessed. Thus your Lord's gracious promise was fulfilled to the Children of Israel, for they had endured with patience; and We destroyed all that Pharaoh and his people had wrought, and all that they had built.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We made the people who were considered weak to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We have blessed. And the fair Word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because of their endurance. And We destroyed what Fir`awn and his people produced, and what they erected.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We caused the folk who were despised to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We had blessed. And the fair word of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their endurance; and We annihilated (all) that Pharaoh and his folk had done and that they had contrived.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We made the people who were abased the heirs to the east and west of the land which We had blessed, and your Lord’s best word [of promise] was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their patience, and We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had built and what they used to erect.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave the persecuted nation dominion over the eastern and western lands which We had blessed. So the Word of your Lord, the finest, was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their patience; and We destroyed the edifices, and towers of Pharaoh and whatsoever they manufactured.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the suppressed people the blessed eastern and western regions as their inheritance. Thus, the promises of your Lord to the children of Israel all came true because of the patience which they exercised. He destroyed all the establishments of the Pharaoh and his people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We made the people who were deemed weak to inherit the eastern lands and the western ones which We had blessed; and the good word of your Lord was fulfilled in the children of Israel because they bore up (sufferings) patiently; and We utterly destroyed what Firon and his people had wrought and what they built.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We made the people who were considered weak inheritors of the eastern parts and western parts of the land which We had blessed. Thus your Lord's good promise to the Children of Israel was fulfilled, because of their patience, and We destroyed all that Pharaoh and his people had built and all that they had raised high.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings. The fair promise of thy Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel, because they had patience and constancy, and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We brought the children of Israel across the sea, and they came to a people who were devoted to their idols, they said: "O Moses, make us also a god like theirs." "You are ignorant," he replied.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea, and they came upon a people cleaving to idols they had. They said, 'Moses, make for us a god, as they have gods.' Said he, 'You are surely a people who are ignorant.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We led the Children of Isra'il across the sea. Then they came upon a people cleaving to the idols they had. T'hev said: Musa! make for us a god even as they have gods. He said: verily ye are a people given to ignorance.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We brought the Children of Israel (with safety) across the sea, and they came upon a people devoted to some of their idols (in worship). They said: "O Musa (Moses)! Make for us an ilahan (a god) as they have aliha (gods)." He said: "Verily, you are a people who know not (the Majesty and Greatness of Allah and what is obligatory upon you, i.e. to worship none but Allah Alone, the One and the Only God of all that exists)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We delivered the Children of Israel across the sea. And when they came upon a people who were devoted to some statues of theirs, they said, “O Moses, make for us a god, as they have gods.” He said, “You are truly an ignorant people.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We led the Children of Israel across the sea; and then they came upon a people who were devoted to the worship of their idols. They said: 'O Moses, make for us a god even as they have gods.' Moses said: 'You are indeed an ignorant people.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We brought the Children of Israel (with safety) across the sea, and they came upon a people devoted to some of their idols (in worship). They said: "O Musa! Make for us a god as they have gods." He said: "Verily, you are an ignorant people."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We brought the Children of Israel across the sea, and they came unto a people who were given up to idols which they had. They said: O Moses! Make for us a god even as they have gods. He said: Lo! ye are a folk who know not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We carried the Children of Israel across the sea, whereat they came upon a people cleaving to certain idols that they had. They said, ‘O Moses, make for us a god like the gods that they have.’ He said, ‘You are indeed an ignorant lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and We moved the Children of Israel from one side of the sea to the other, and they came upon a nation zealously devoted to the idols they had. They said to Moses: 'Make a god for us, as they have gods' Moses replied: 'You are indeed an ignorant nation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We helped the children of Israel to cross the sea. They came to a people who worshipped idols. The Israelites demanded Moses to make gods for them like those of the idol-worshippers. Moses told them, "You are an ignorant people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We made the children of Israel to pass the sea; then they came upon a people who kept to the worship of their idols They said: O Musa! make for us a god as they have (their) gods He said: Surely you are a people acting ignorantly:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We brought the children of Israel across the sea and they came upon a people who were devoted to their idols. They said, "Moses, give us a god just like the gods these people have." He said, "You are indeed an ignorant people:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We took the Children of Israel (with safety) across the sea. They came upon a people devoted entirely to some idols they had. They said: "O Moses! fashion for us a god like unto the gods they have." He said: "Surely ye are a people without knowledge.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "These people and their ways will surely be destroyed, for false is what they practise.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Surely this they are engaged upon shall be shattered, and void is what they have been doing.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily these! destroyed is that wherein they are engaged and vain is that which they have been doing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Musa (Moses) added:] "Verily, these people will be destroyed for that which they are engaged in (idols-worship). And all that they are doing is in vain."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “What these people are concerned with is perdition, and their deeds are based on falsehoods.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The way these people follow is bound to lead to destruction; and all their works are vain.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: [Musa added:] "Verily, these people will be destroyed for that which they are engaged in (idols' worship). And all that they are doing is in vain."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! as for these, their way will be destroyed and all that they are doing is in vain.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: What they are engaged in is indeed bound to perish, and what they have been doing shall come to naught.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: That which they are engaged upon shall be shattered and all their works are vain.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: What these people worship is doomed to be destroyed and their deeds are based on falsehood.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: (As to) these, surely that about which they are shall be brought to naught and that which they do is vain.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: what they are engaged in is doomed to destruction and all their works are in vain."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "As to these folk,- the cult they are in is (but) a fragment of a ruin, and vain is the (worship) which they practise."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Do you want me to seek for you," he said, "a god other than God, when He has exalted you over all the nations of the world?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He said, 'What, shall I seek a god for you other than God, who has preferred you above all beings?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: shall I seek for you a god other than Allah, whereas He hath preferred you above the worlds?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He said: "Shall I seek for you an Ilahan (a God) other than Allah, while He has given you superiority over the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns of your time)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Shall I seek for you a god other than God, when He has favored you over all other people?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Moses said: 'Should I seek any god for you other than Allah although it is He who has exalted you above all?'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "Shall I seek for you an ilah (a god) other than Allah, while He has given you superiority over the nations."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Shall I seek for you a god other than Allah when He hath favoured you above (all) creatures?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Shall I find you a god other than Allah, while He has graced you over all the nations?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Should I seek any god for you except Allah? He has exalted you above the nations.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "Is it other than Allah I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Should I choose for you a lord other than God who has favored you above all other people?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: What! shall I seek for you a god other than Allah while He has made you excel (all) created things?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He said, "Shall I seek a deity for you other than God, while it is He who has exalted you above all peoples?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Shall I seek for you a god other than the (true) Allah, when it is Allah Who hath endowed you with gifts above the nations?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Remember (the day) when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh who oppressed and afflicted you, and slew your sons and spared your women. In this was a great trial from your Lord."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh who were visiting you with evil chastisement, slaying your sons, and sparing your women -- and in that was a grievous trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We delivered you from the house of Fir'awn perpetrating on you terrible torment, slaying your sons and letting your women live, and therein was a trial from your Lord, tremendous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We rescued you from Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people, who were afflicting you with the worst torment, killing your sons and letting your women live. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Remember how We saved you from Pharaoh’s people, who subjected you to the worst of sufferings—killing your sons and sparing your women. In that was a tremendous trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And call to mind when We delivered you from Pharaoh's people who perpetrated on you a terrible torment, putting your males to death and sparing your females. Surely in it there was an awesome trial for you from your Lord.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We rescued you from Fir`awn's people, who were afflicting you with the worst torment, killing your sons and letting your women live. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when We did deliver you from Pharaoh's folk who were afflicting you with dreadful torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women. That was a tremendous trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when We delivered you from Pharaoh’s clan who inflicted on you a terrible torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women, and there was a great test in that from your Lord.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And that We saved you from Pharaoh's family, who had oppressed you cruelly, putting your sons to death and sparing your women. Surely, that was a great trial from your Lord'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: "Children of Israel, when I saved you from the Pharaoh and his people who made you suffer the worst kinds of torment, killing your sons and keeping your women alive, it was a great trial for you from your Lord."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We delivered you from Firon's people who subjected you to severe torment, killing your sons and sparing your women, and in this there was a great trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We delivered you from Pharaoh's people, who afflicted you with dreadful torment, slaying your male children and sparing only your daughters. That was surely a great trial for you by your Lord."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember We rescued you from Pharaoh's people, who afflicted you with the worst of penalties, who slew your male children and saved alive your females: in that was a momentous trial from your Lord.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They (had experienced) under the Pharaoh. He was certainly a tyrant, guilty of excess.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: from Pharaoh; surely he was a high One, of the prodigals;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: From Fir'awn; verily he was haughty and of the extravagant.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: From Fir'aun (Pharaoh); Verily! He was arrogant and was of the Musrifun (those who transgress beyond bound in spending and other things and commit great sins).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: From Pharaoh. He was a transgressing tyrant.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: from Pharaoh who was most prominent among the prodigals.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: From Fir`awn; verily, he was arrogant and was of the excessive.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (We delivered them) from Pharaoh. Lo! he was a tyrant of the wanton ones.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: of Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a tyrant among the transgressors.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: from Pharaoh, who ranked high in sin,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and from the Pharaoh. He was the chief of the transgressors.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: From Firon; surely he was haughty, (and) one of the extravagant.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: at the hands of Pharaoh: he was a tyrant who exceeded all bounds.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Inflicted by Pharaoh, for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate transgressors.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We exalted them over the other people knowingly,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and We chose them, out of a knowledge, above all beings,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We elected them with knowledge above the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We chose them (the Children of Israel) above the 'Alamin (mankind, and jinns) [during the time of Musa (Moses)] with knowledge,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We chose them knowingly over all other people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We knowingly exalted them (i.e., the Children of Israel) above other peoples of the world

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We chose them above the nations (Al-`Alamin) with knowledge,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We chose them, purposely, above (all) creatures.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We chose them knowingly above all the nations,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and We chose them, out of a knowledge above the nations (of their time).

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly chose them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave preference to the Israelites over the other people with Our knowledge

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We chose them, having knowledge, above the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We knowingly chose them above all other people

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We chose them aforetime above the nations, knowingly,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: After this We told the children of Israel: "Dwell in the land. When the promise of reckoning comes, We shall bring you together from a motley crowd.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We said to the Children of Israel after him, 'Dwell in the land; and when the promise of the world to come comes to pass, We shall bring you a rabble.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We said, after him, unto the Children of Isra'l: dwell on the earth, then when there cometh the promise of the Hereafter, We shall bring you as a crowd.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We said to the Children of Israel after him: "Dwell in the land, then, when the final and the last promise comes near [i.e. the Day of Resurrection or the descent of Christ ['Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary) on the earth]. We shall bring you altogether as mixed crowd (gathered out of various nations). [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 10, Page 338]

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: After him, We said to the Children of Israel, “Inhabit the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter arrives, We will bring you all together.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and thereafter We said to the Children of Israel: "Now dwell in the land, but when the promised time of the Hereafter comes, We shall bring you all together."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We said to the Children of Israel after him: "Dwell in the land, then, when the final and the last promise comes near, We shall bring you altogether as mixed crowd."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We said unto the Children of Israel after him: Dwell in the land; but when the promise of the Hereafter cometh to pass We shall bring you as a crowd gathered out of various nations.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: After him We said to the Children of Israel, ‘Take up residence in the land, and when the occasion of the other [promise] comes, We shall gather you in mixed company.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And thereafter We said to the Children of Israel: 'Dwell in the land. When the promise of the Everlasting Life comes We shall bring you all together'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We told the Israelites after this to settle in the land until Our second promise will come true. We would then gather them all together (on the Day of Judgment).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We said to the Israelites after him: Dwell in the land: and when the promise of the next life shall come to pass, we will bring you both together in judgment.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Thereafter, We said to the Israelites, "Dwell in the land. When the promise of the Hereafter comes to be fulfilled, We shall assemble you all together."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel, "Dwell securely in the land (of promise)": but when the second of the warnings came to pass, We gathered you together in a mingled crowd.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember when We sent Moses with Our signs (We said): "Bring your people out of darkness into light, and remind them of the visitations of God. Indeed there are signs in this for every steadfast, thankful soul"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Moses with Our signs -- 'Bring forth thy people from the shadows to the light and remind thou them of the Days of God.' Surely in that are signs for every man enduring, thankful!

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Musa with our signs saying: bring thy people forth from the darknesses unto the light, and remind them of the annals of Allah. Verily therein are signs for everyone patient, and thankful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (signs, proofs, and evidences) (saying): "Bring out your people from darkness into light, and make them remember the annals of Allah. Truly, therein are evidences, proofs and signs for every patient, thankful (person)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs: “Bring your people out of darkness into light, and remind them of the Days of God.” In that are signs for every patient and thankful person.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We indeed sent Moses with Our Signs, saying: "Lead your people out of all kinds of darkness into light, and admonish them by narrating to them anecdotes from the Days of Allah." Verily in it there are great Signs for everyone who is patient and gives thanks (to Allah).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa with Our Ayat (saying): "Bring out your people from darkness into light, and remind them of the annals (or days) of Allah. Truly, therein are Ayat for every patient, thankful (person)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We verily sent Moses with Our revelations, saying: Bring thy people forth from darkness unto light. And remind them of the days of Allah. Lo! therein are revelations for each steadfast, thankful (heart).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs: ‘Bring your people out from darkness into light and remind them of Allah’s [holy] days. There are indeed signs in that for every patient and grateful [servant].’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs, 'Bring your nation out of darkness into the light, and remind them of the Days of Allah' Surely, in that are signs for every patient, thankful (person).

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring out your people from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allah." Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Moses and gave him miracles in order to lead his people from darkness into light and to remind them of the days of God. In this there is evidence (of the truth) for those who exercise patience and give thanks.

translation.author: Shakir
