translation.text: Again, We gave the Book to Musa to complete (Our blessings) on him who would do good (to others), and making plain all things and a guidance and a mercy, so that they should believe in the meeting of their Lord.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We gave Moses the Book, completing [Our favour] to the righteous, explaining everything clearly, as guidance and mercy, so that they might believe in meeting their Lord.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Moreover, We gave Moses the Book, completing (Our favour) to those who would do right, and explaining all things in detail,- and a guide and a mercy, that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guidance for the children of Israel that they should not take another protector apart from Me.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guidance to the Children of Israel: 'Take not unto yourselves any guardian apart from Me.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We vouchsafed unto Musa the Book and We appointed it as a guidance to the Children of Isra'il: take not beside Me a trustee.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel (saying): "Take not other than Me as (your) Wakil (Protector, Lord, or Disposer of your affairs, etc).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Scripture, and made it a guide for the Children of Israel: Take none for protector other than Me.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a source of guidance for the Children of Israel, commanding: "Take no other Guardian beside Me."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We gave Musa the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel (saying): "Take none other than Me as (your) Wakil."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We gave unto Moses the Scripture, and We appointed it a guidance for the children of Israel, saying: Choose no guardian beside Me.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guide for the Children of Israel—[saying,] ‘Do not take any trustee besides Me’—

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book and made it a guide for the Children of Israel. 'Take no guardian other than Me.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Moses We gave the Book and made it a guide for the children of Israel, so that they would not have any one as their guardian other than Me

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We gave Musa the Book and made it a guidance to the children of Israel, saying: Do not take a protector besides Me;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book and made it a guide for the Children of Israel saying, "Do not take anyone besides Me as a guardian,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a Guide to the Children of Israel, (commanding): "Take not other than Me as Disposer of (your) affairs."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We gave Moses the Book; so be not in doubt about his having received it; and We made it a guidance for the children of Israel.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Indeed, We gave Moses the Book; so he not in doubt concerning the encounter with him; and We appointed it for a guidance to the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Assuredly We vouchsafed the Book Unto Musa; so be thou not in doubt in thy receiving it. And We appointed it to be a guidance unto the Children of Is'rail.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture [the Taurat (Torah)]. So be not you in doubt of meeting him [i.e. when you met Musa (Moses) during the night of Al-Isra' and Al-Mi'raj over the heavens]. And We made it [the Taurat (Torah)] a guide to the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book; so do not be in doubt regarding His encounter; and We made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Verily We bestowed the Book upon Moses. So entertain no doubt if (the Prophet Muhammad) received the same. We had made that Book a guidance for the Children of Israel,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa the Scripture. So, be not you in doubt of meeting him. And We made it a guide to the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We verily gave Moses the Scripture; so be not ye in doubt of his receiving it; and We appointed it a guidance for the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, [declaring], ‘Do not be in doubt about the encounter with Him,’ and We made it a [source of] guidance for the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We have given the Book to Moses, so (Prophet Muhammad) do not be in doubt concerning the meeting with him (Prophet Moses) and made it a guidance to the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so do not be in doubt over his meeting. And we made the Torah guidance for the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses - do not have any doubt about the Day of Judgment - and made it a guide for the children of Israel.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave the Book to Musa, so be not in doubt concerning the receiving of it, and We made it a guide for the children of Israel.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Scripture, so [Muhammad] do not doubt that you are receiving it, just as We made it a guide for the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did indeed aforetime give the Book to Moses: be not then in doubt of its reaching (thee): and We made it a guide to the Children of Israel.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We showed Moses the way, and bequeathed the Book to the children of Israel,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also gave Moses the guidance, and We bequeathed upon the Children of Israel the Book

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed Unto Musa the guidance, and We caused the Children of Isra'il to inherit the Book.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture [i.e. the Taurat (Torah)],

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses guidance, and made the Children of Israel inherit the Scripture.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We surely guided Moses and made the Children of Israel the heirs of the Book

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Musa the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture --

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave guidance to Moses and We gave the Children of Israel the Book as a legacy,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave Moses the Guidance and bequeathed upon the Children of Israel the Book

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Moses guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Moses We had given guidance and to the children of Israel We had given the Book

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave Musa the guidance, and We made the children of Israel inherit the Book,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses Our guidance, and made the Children of Israel the inheritors of the Book --

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and a light and reminder for those who take heed for themselves,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Salvation and a Radiance, and a Remembrance for the godfearing

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vcuchsafed unto Musa and Harun the distinction and illumination and an admonition for the God-fearing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We granted to Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron) the criterion (of right and wrong), and a shining light [i.e. the Taurat (Torah)] and a Reminder for Al-Muttaqun (the pious - see V. 2:2).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and illumination, and a reminder for the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We had granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (between right and wrong), and Light and Admonition for the good of the God-fearing,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We granted to Musa and Harun the criterion, and a shining light and a Reminder for those who have Taqwa.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) and a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, a light and reminder for the Godwary

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and gave them a light and a Remembrance for the cautious:

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Moses and Aaron We granted the criteria of discerning right from wrong, and We gave them the light and a reminder to the pious ones

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave to Musa and Haroun the Furqan and a light and a reminder for those who would guard (against evil).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses and Aaron the criterion of right and wrong and a light and reminder for the righteous,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Will he who has a clear proof from his Lord, which acts as evidence from Him, before which the Book of Moses was a way-giver and a grace, (not believe in it)? Whoever among the partisans does not believe in it shall have Hell as the promised award. So have no doubt about it, for surely it's the truth from your Lord, though most men may not believe.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And what of him who stands upon a clear sign from his Lord, and a witness from Him recites it, and before him is the Book of Moses for an ensample and a mercy? Those believe in it; but whosoever disbelieves in it, being one of the partisans, his promised land is the Fire. So be thou not in doubt of it; it is the truth from thy Lord, but most men do not believe.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Is he like unto him who resteth upon an evidence from His Lord, so and there rehearseth it a witness from Him And before it was the Book of Musa, a pattern and a mercy; these believe therein; and whosoever of the sects disbelieveth therein, the Fire is his promised place. Be then thou not in dubitation thereof, verily it is the truth from thy Lord, yet most of the mankind believe not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Can they (Muslims) who rely on a clear proof (the Quran) from their Lord, and whom a witness [Prophet Muhammad SAW through Jibrael (Gabriel)] from Him follows it (can they be equal with the disbelievers); and before it, came the Book of Musa (Moses), a guidance and a mercy, they believe therein, but those of the sects (Jews, Christians and all the other non-Muslim nations) that reject it (the Quran), the Fire will be their promised meeting-place. So be not in doubt about it (i.e. those who denied Prophet Muhammad SAW and also denied all that which he brought from Allah, surely, they will enter Hell). Verily, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the mankind believe not.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Is he who possesses a clear proof from his Lord, recited by a witness from Him, and before it the Book of Moses, a guide and a mercy? These believe in it. But whoever defies it from among the various factions, the Fire is his promise. So have no doubt about it. It is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not believe.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Can they who rely on a clear proof from their Lord, and whom a witness from Him recites (follows) it; and before it, came the Book of Musa, a guidance and a mercy, they believe therein, but those of the sects that reject it, the Fire will be their promised meeting place. So be not in doubt about it. Verily, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of mankind believe not.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Is he (to be counted equal with them) who relieth on a clear proof from his Lord, and a witness from Him reciteth it, and before it was the Book of Moses, an example and a mercy? Such believe therein, and whoso disbelieveth therein of the clans, the Fire is his appointed place. So be not thou in doubt concerning it. Lo! it is the Truth from thy Lord; but most of mankind believe not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Is he who stands on a manifest proof from his Lord, and whom a witness of his own [family] follows? And before him there was the Book of Moses, a guide and mercy. It is they who have faith in it, and whoever defies him from among the factions, the Fire is their tryst. So do not be in doubt about it; it is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not have faith.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then what of he who stands upon a clear proof from his Lord, recited by a witness from Him and before him is the Book of Moses for a guide and a mercy? Those believe in it. But as for those partisans who disbelieve in it, their promised land shall be the Fire. Therefore do not doubt it. It is the truth from your Lord, yet most people do not believe.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]? And a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy. Those [believers in the former revelations] believe in the Qur'an. But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions - the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Should they be compared with those whose Lord has given them a guidance which is testified by a witness from among their own people and by the Book of Moses, a guide and a mercy. Such people do believe in this guidance (in the Quran). Those who disbelieve (in the Quran) will have hell as their dwelling place. Thus, (Muhammad), have no doubt about it (the Quran). It is certainly the truth from your Lord, yet many people do not have faith.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Is he then who has with him clear proof from his Lord, and a witness from Him recites it and before it (is) the Book of Musa, a guide and a mercy? These believe in it; and whoever of the (different) parties disbelieves in it, surely it is the truth from your Lord, but most men do not believe.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Can they be compared to those who possess a clear proof from their Lord, followed up by a witness from Him, preceded by the Book of Moses, as a guide and a mercy? These people believe in it; whereas those groups that deny its truth are promised the Fire. Therefore, have no doubt about it. It is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not believe it.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Can they be (like) those who accept a Clear (Sign) from their Lord, and whom a witness from Himself doth teach, as did the Book of Moses before it,- a guide and a mercy? They believe therein; but those of the Sects that reject it,- the Fire will be their promised meeting-place. Be not then in doubt thereon: for it is the truth from thy Lord: yet many among men do not believe!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He has verily revealed to you this Book, in truth and confirmation of the Books revealed before, as indeed He had revealed the Torah and the Gospel

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He has sent down upon thee the Book with the truth, confirming what was before it, and He sent down the Torah and the Gospel

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He hath revealed unto thee the Book with truth confirming that which went before it; and He sent down the Taurat and Injil.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: It is He Who has sent down the Book (the Quran) to you (Muhammad SAW) with truth, confirming what came before it. And he sent down the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He sent down to you the Book with the Truth, confirming what came before it; and He sent down the Torah and the Gospel.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He has revealed this Book to you, setting forth the truth and confirming the earlier Books, and earlier He revealed the Torah and Gospel

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: It is He Who has sent down the Book to you with truth, confirming what came before it. And He sent down the Tawrah and the Injil,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He hath revealed unto thee (Muhammad) the Scripture with truth, confirming that which was (revealed) before it, even as He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He has sent down to you the Book with the truth, confirming what was [revealed] before it, and He had sent down the Torah and the Evangel

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He has sent down to you the Book with the truth, confirming what preceded it; and He has sent down the Torah and the Gospel (of Prophet Jesus which has been lost)

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He has sent the Book (Quran) to you (Muhammad) in all Truth. It confirms the original Bible. He revealed the Torah and the Gospel

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He has revealed to you the Book with truth, verifying that which is before it, and He revealed the Tavrat and the Injeel aforetime, a guidance for the people, and He sent the Furqan.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He has sent down the Book to you with truth, which fulfils [the predictions] in the Scriptures that preceded it: He sent down the Torah and the Gospel

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: It is He Who sent down to thee (step by step), in truth, the Book, confirming what went before it; and He sent down the Law (of Moses) and the Gospel (of Jesus) before this, as a guide to mankind, and He sent down the criterion (of judgment between right and wrong).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember We gave Moses the Book and sent after him many an apostle; and to Jesus, son of Mary, We gave clear evidence of the truth, reinforcing him with divine grace. Even so, when a messenger brought to you what did not suit your mood you turned haughty, and called some imposters and some others you slew.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Moosa (Moses) the Book and subsequent to him, sent Noble Messengers one after another – and We gave Eisa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), clear proofs and supported him with the Holy Spirit; so when a Noble Messenger from Allah comes to you bringing what you yourselves do not desire, you grow arrogant; so you disbelieve in a group of the Prophets and another group of Prophets you slay!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave to Moses the Book, and after him sent succeeding Messengers; and We gave Jesus son of Mary the clear signs, and confirmed him with the Holy Spirit; and whensoever there came to you a Messenger with that your souls had not desire for, did you become arrogant, and some cry lies to, and some slay?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed unto Musa the Book and We followed him up by the apostles after him, and unto 'lsa, son of Maryam, We vouchsafed evidences and aided him with the Holy Spirit. Then so often as there came unto you an apostle with that which your souls desired not, ye waxed stiff necked; and some ye belied and some ye slew?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed, We gave Musa (Moses) the Book and followed him up with a succession of Messengers. And We gave 'Iesa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), clear signs and supported him with Ruh-ul-Qudus [Jibrael (Gabriel)]. Is it that whenever there came to you a Messenger with what you yourselves desired not, you grew arrogant? Some, you disbelieved and some, you killed.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Scripture, and sent a succession of messengers after him. And We gave Jesus son of Mary the clear proofs, and We supported him with the Holy Spirit. Is it that whenever a messenger comes to you with anything your souls do not desire, you grew arrogant, calling some impostors, and killing others?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book and sent after him a train of Messengers in succession. Then We sent Jesus, son of Mary, with clear Signs and supported him with the Holy Spirit. Then how is it that whenever a Messenger came to you wish that which did not suit your lusts, you grew rebellious against him, and repudiated some and slew others.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed, We gave Musa the Book and followed him up with a succession of Messengers. And We gave `Isa, the son of Maryam, clear signs and supported him with Ruh-il-Qudus. Is it that whenever there came to you a Messenger with what you yourselves desired not, you grew arrogant Some you disbelieved and some you killed.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We gave unto Moses the Scripture and We caused a train of messengers to follow after him, and We gave unto Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs (of Allah's sovereignty), and We supported him with the Holy spirit. Is it ever so, that, when there cometh unto you a messenger (from Allah) with that which ye yourselves desire not, ye grow arrogant, and some ye disbelieve and some ye slay?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly, We gave Moses the Book and followed him with the apostles, and We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, manifest proofs and confirmed him with the Holy Spirit. Is it not that whenever an apostle brought you that which was not to your liking, you would act arrogantly; so you would impugn a group [of them], and slay a[nother] group?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: To Moses We gave the Book and after him We sent other Messengers. We gave (Prophet) Jesus, the son of Mary, veritable signs, and supported him with the Spirit of Purity (Gabriel). Will you then become proud whenever any Messenger comes to you with that which does not suit your fancies, and you belied some (Prophet Jesus) and killed others!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly give Moses the Torah and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses and made the Messengers follow in his path. To Jesus, the son of Mary, We gave the miracles and supported him by the Holy Spirit. Why do you arrogantly belie some Messengers and murder others whenever they have brought you messages that you dislike?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And most certainly We gave Musa the Book and We sent apostles after him one after another; and We gave Isa, the son of Marium, clear arguments and strengthened him with the holy spirit, What! whenever then an apostle came to you with that which your souls did not desire, you were insolent so you called some liars and some you slew.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: To Moses We gave the Book and sent a succession of messengers after him. We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear signs and strengthened him with the Holy Spirit. But, whenever a messenger came to you with something which you did not desire, you grew arrogant, calling some liars and slaying others.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book and followed him up with a succession of messengers; We gave Jesus the son of Mary Clear (Signs) and strengthened him with the holy spirit. Is it that whenever there comes to you a messenger with what ye yourselves desire not, ye are puffed up with pride?- Some ye called impostors, and others ye slay!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: There was the Book of Moses before this, a guide and a mercy; and here is this Book confirming it in lucid language, warning those who are wicked, and giving happy tidings to the righteous.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Yet before it was the Book of Moses for a model and a mercy; and this is a Book confirming, in Arabic tongue, to warn the evildoers, and good tidings to the good-doers.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And before it there hath been the Book of Musa, a guide and a mercy. And this a Book confirming it, in Arabic speech, that it may warn those who have done wrong and as glad tidings Unto the well-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And before this was the Scripture of Musa (Moses) as a guide and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book (the Quran) in the Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong, and as glad tidings to the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And before it was the Book of Moses, a model and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book, in the Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong—and good news for the doers of good.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Yet before this the Book was revealed to Moses as a guide and a mercy. This Book, which confirms it, is in the Arabic tongue to warn the wrong-doers and to give good tidings to those who do good.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And before this was the Scripture of Musa as a guide and a mercy. And this is a Book confirming in the Arabic tongue, to warn those who do wrong, and as glad tidings for the doers of good.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: When before it there was the Scripture of Moses, an example and a mercy; and this is a confirming Scripture in the Arabic language, that it may warn those who do wrong and bring good tidings for the righteous.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Yet before it the Book of Moses was a guide and mercy, and this is a Book in the Arabic language, which confirms it, [sent] to warn the wrongdoers, and is a [bearer of] good news for the virtuous.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Yet before it there was the Book of Moses which was an authority, and a mercy. This (Koran) is the Book confirming it (the other untampered Books) in theArabic tongue, to warn the harmdoers and to give glad tidings to those who do good.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Before this (Quran), the Book of Moses was a guide and a blessing. This Book confirms the Torah. It is in the Arabic language so that it may warn the unjust people, and give glad news to the righteous ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And before it the Book of Musa was a guide and a mercy: and this is a Book verifying (it) in the Arabic language that it may warn those who are unjust and as good news for the doers of good.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Yet the scripture of Moses was revealed before it as a guide and a blessing; and this is a Book in the Arabic language, fulfilling [previous prophecies], to forewarn those who do evil and to bring good news to those who do good.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And before this, was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy: And this Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the unjust, and as Glad Tidings to those who do right.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "O our people:" they said: "we have listened to a Book which has come down after Moses, confirming what was (sent down) before it, showing the way to the truth and a path that is straight.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'Our people, we have heard a Book that was sent down after Moses, confirming what was before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: O our people! verily we have hearkened Unto a Book sent down after Musa, confirming that which was before it, guiding Unto the truth and a straight path.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "O our people! Verily! We have heard a Book (this Quran) sent down after Musa (Moses), confirming what came before it, it guides to the truth and to a Straight Path (i.e. Islam).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “O our people, we have heard a Scripture, sent down after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth, and to a straight path.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They said: “Our people, We have heard a Scripture revealed after Moses, verifying the Scriptures revealed before it; it guides to the Truth and to the Straight Way.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "O our people! Verily, we have heard a Book sent down after Musa, confirming what came before it, it guides to the truth and to the straight path."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: O our people! Lo! we have heard a scripture which hath been revealed after Moses, confirming that which was before it, guiding unto the truth and a right road.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘O our people! Indeed, we have heard a Book, which has been sent down after Moses, confirming what was before it. It guides to the truth and to a straight path.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Our nation' they said: 'we have just been listening to a Book sent down after Moses confirming what came before it and guiding to the truth and to aStraight Path.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a [recited] Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it which guides to the truth and to a straight path.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and said, "Our people, we have listened to the recitation of a Book revealed after Moses. It confirms the Books revealed before and guides to the Truth and the right path.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: O our people! we have listened to a Book revealed after Musa verifying that which is before it, guiding to the truth and to a right path:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "O our people, we have heard a Book, which has been sent down after Moses, fulfilling the predictions existing in previous scriptures; it guides to the truth, and to the right path.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "O our people! We have heard a Book revealed after Moses, confirming what came before it: it guides (men) to the Truth and to a Straight Path.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said: "Why is he not given the like of what was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve before in what was given to Moses? They said: "Both are imposters one like the other," and added: "We do not believe in either."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Yet when the truth came to them 'from Ourselves, they said, 'Why has he not been given the like' of that Moses was given?' But they, did they not disbelieve also in what Moses was given aforetime? They said, 'A pair of sorceries mutually supporting each other.' They said, 'We disbelieve both.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Yet when the truth is come unto them from before Us, they say: wherefore hast he not been vouchsafed the like of that which was given unto Musa? Disbelieved they not in that which was given unto Musa aforetime? They say; two magics supporting each other. And they say: verily in all such things we are disbelievers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: But when the truth (i.e. Muhammad SAW with his Message) has come to them from Us, they say: "Why is he not given the like of what was given to Musa (Moses)? Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Musa (Moses) of old? They say: "Two kinds of magic [the Taurat (Torah) and the Quran] each helping the other!" And they say: "Verily! In both we are disbelievers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “If only he was given the like of what was given to Moses.” Did they not disbelieve in what was given to Moses in the past? They said, “Two works of magic backing one another.” And they said, “We are disbelieving in both.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: But when the Truth reached them from Us, they said: "Why was he not given that which was given to Moses?" But did they not reject before what had been given to Moses? They said: "Both are magic, each supporting the other!" And they said: "We deny each of these."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: But when the truth has come to them from Us, they say: "Why is he not given the like of what was given to Musa Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Musa of old" They say: "Two kinds of magic, each helping the other!" And they say: "Verily, in both we are disbelievers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: But when there came unto them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Why is he not given the like of what was given unto Moses? Did they not disbelieve in that which was given unto Moses of old? They say: Two magics that support each other; and they say: Lo! in both we are disbelievers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: But when there came to them the truth from Us, they said, ‘Why has he not been given the like of what Moses was given?’ Did they not disbelieve what Moses was given before, and said, ‘Two magicians abetting each other,’ and said, ‘Indeed we disbelieve both of them’?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So when the truth (Prophet Muhammad) came to them from Us, they said: 'Why is he not given the like of that which was given to Moses' But did they not also disbelieve in that which Moses was given before! They say (about Moses and Aaron): 'Two sorcerers supporting one another' And they said: 'We disbelieve both'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the Truth from Us came to them they said, "Would that he, (Muhammad), had received what was given to Moses (by his Lord)." Did not they reject what Moses had brought to them saying, "These two, Moses and Aaron, are two magicians who support each other. We do not have any faith in them."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: But (now) when the truth has come to them from Us, they say: Why is he not given the like of what was given to Musa? What! did they not disbelieve in what Musa was given before? They say: Two magicians backing up each other; and they say: Surely we are unbelievers in all.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why has he not been given the like of what Moses was given?" But did they not reject what Moses was given before? They said, "Both [Moses and Muhammad] are kinds of sorcery, each assisting the other." And they add, "We reject both of them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But (now), when the Truth has come to them from Ourselves, they say, "Why are not (Signs) sent to him, like those which were sent to Moses?" Do they not then reject (the Signs) which were formerly sent to Moses? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery, each assisting the other!" And they say: "For us, we reject all (such things)!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We were indeed gracious to Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We also favoured Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We gave grace Unto Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Our Grace to Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We blessed Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Verily We bestowed Our favours on Moses and Aaron

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And, indeed We gave Our grace to Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave grace unto Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We favoured Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We also favored Moses and Aaron

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We certainly bestowed Our favor upon Moses and Aaron

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We conferred a favor on Musa and Haroun.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We also bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Again (of old) We bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Peace be on Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'Peace be upon Moses and, Aaron!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Peace be Unto Musa and Harun.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Salamun (peace) be upon Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Salam (peace!) be upon Musa and Harun!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Peace be unto Moses and Aaron!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘Peace be to Moses and Aaron!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Peace be upon Moses and Aaron'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Peace be with Moses and Aaron.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Peace be on Musa and Haroun.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "Peace be upon Moses and Aaron!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Peace and salutation to Moses and Aaron!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: O you who believe, do not be like those who maligned Moses, whilst God cleared him of what they alleged; and he was held in high esteem with God.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: O believers, be not as those who hurt Moses, but God declared him quit of what they said, and he was high honoured with God.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Ye who believe! be not like unto those who annoyed Musa; but Allah cleared him of that which they said, and he was in the sight of Allah illustrious.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O you who believe! Be not like those who annoyed Musa (Moses), but Allah cleared him of that which they alleged, and he was honourable before Allah.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O you who believe! Do not be like those who abused Moses; but God cleared him of what they said. He was distinguished with God.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Believers, do not be like those who distressed Moses and then Allah declared him quit of the ill they spoke about him; and he had a high standing with Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O you who believe! Be not like those who annoyed Musa, but Allah cleared him of that which they alleged, and he was honorable before Allah.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O ye who believe! Be not as those who slandered Moses, but Allah proved his innocence of that which they alleged, and he was well esteemed in Allah's sight.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: O you who have faith! Do not be like those who offended Moses, whereat Allah cleared him of what they alleged, and he was distinguished in Allah’s sight.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Believers, do not be like those who hurt Moses. Allah cleared him of what they said. His face is honorable with Allah.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then Allah cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allah, was distinguished.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Believers, do not be like those who annoyed Moses. God proved him to be innocent of what they had said about him. Moses was a honorable person in the sight of God.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O you who believe! be not like those who spoke evil things of Musa, but Allah cleared him of what they said, and he was worthy of regard with Allah.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Believers, do not behave like those who slandered Moses. God cleared him of their allegations. He was honourable in the sight of God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye who believe! Be ye not like those who vexed and insulted Moses, but Allah cleared him of the (calumnies) they had uttered: and he was honourable in Allah's sight.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Among the people of Moses is a section that shows the way to the truth, and deals justly in accordance with it.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Of the people of Moses there is a nation who guide by the truth, and by it act with justice.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And of the people of Musa there is a community guiding others by the truth and judging thereby.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And of the people of Musa (Moses) there is a community who lead (the men) with truth and establish justice therewith (i.e. judge men with truth and justice).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Among the people of Moses is a community that guides by truth, and thereby does justice.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Among the people of Moses' there was a party who guided others in the way of the truth and established justice in its light.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And of the people of Musa there is a community who lead (the men) with truth and establish justice therewith.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And of Moses' folk there is a community who lead with truth and establish justice therewith.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Among the people of Moses is a nation who guide [the people] by the truth and do justice thereby.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Yet among the people of Moses there was a nation who preached the truth and acted justly.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Among the people of Moses are some whose guidance and Judgment are based on the Truth.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And of Musa's people was a party who guided (people) with the truth, and thereby did they do justice.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Yet there is a group among the people of Moses who guide with truth and act justly in accordance with it.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Of the people of Moses there is a section who guide and do justice in the light of truth.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We gave to Moses the Book, but there was disagreement about it. Had the decree of your Lord (delaying it) not been issued the matter would have been settled between them. They are still suspicious of it and in doubt.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book; and there was difference regarding it, and but for a word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are in doubt of it disquieting.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly vouchsafed unto Musa the Book, and disputation arose thereabout; and had not a word preceded from thy Lord, it would have been decreed between them. And verily they are concerning that in doubt disquieting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Indeed, We gave the Book to Musa (Moses), but differences arose therein, and had it not been for a Word that had gone forth before from your Lord, the case would have been judged between them, and indeed they are in grave doubt concerning it (this Quran).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Scripture, but it was disputed. Were it not for a prior word from your Lord, it would have been settled between them. They are in serious doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We certainly gave Moses the Book before, and there arose disagreements about it (even as there are disagreements now about the Book revealed to you). Had it not been for a decree that had already gone forth from your Lord, the matter would have long been decided between them. Indeed they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Indeed, We gave the Book to Musa, but differences arose therein, and had it not been for a Word that had gone forth before from your Lord, the case would have been judged between them, and indeed they are in grave doubt concerning it (this Qur'an).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And we verily gave unto Moses the Scripture, and there was strife thereupon; and had it not been for a Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord, the case would have been judged between them, and lo! they are in grave doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, but differences arose about it, and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, a decision would have been made between them; indeed they are in grave doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, but they differed regarding it, but for a word that preceded from your Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are indisquieting doubt of it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses but people had different views about it. Had the Word of your Lord not been already ordained, He would have settled their differences (there and then). They are still in doubt about this.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave the book to Musa, but it was gone against; and had not a word gone forth from your Lord, the matter would surely have been decided between them; and surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We certainly gave the Book to Moses, but differences arose about it: had it not been that a word had gone forth before from your Lord, Judgement would indeed have been passed on them then and there: yet they are in grave doubt about it.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We certainly gave the Book to Moses, but differences arose therein: had it not been that a word had gone forth before from thy Lord, the matter would have been decided between them, but they are in suspicious doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Verily We gave Moses the Book; but they began to differ about it. If the Word of your Lord had not preceded it the matter would have been settled between them. They are still in doubt about it and uneasy.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book; and there was difference concerning it, and but for a Word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are in doubt of it disquieting.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed Unto Musa the Book, and difference arose concerning it; and had not a word gone forth from thy Lord, the affair would have been decreed between them. And verily they are in regard thereto in doubt and dubitating.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture, but dispute arose therein. And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, (the torment would have overtaken them) and the matter would have been settled between them. But truly, they are in grave doubt thereto (i.e. about the Quran). [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 15, Page 370]

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, but disputes arose concerning it. Were it not for a prior decree from your Lord, judgment would have been pronounced between them. But they are in perplexing doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And in the past We gave Moses the Book and yet it became an object of dispute. If your Lord's decree had not gone forth before, a decisive judgement would have been made among them, once and for all. Surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa the Scripture, but dispute arose therein. And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, and the matter would have been settled between them. But truly, they are in grave doubt thereto.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, but there hath been dispute concerning it; and but for a Word that had already gone forth from thy Lord, it would ere now have been judged between them; but lo! they are in hopeless doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, but differences arose about it; and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, judgement would have been made between them, for they are in grave doubt concerning it.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses, but there were disputes about it, and had it not been for a Word that preceded from your Lord (their disputes) would have been decided between them. But they are in disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had already given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We had given the Book to Moses about which people greatly disagreed. Had the word of your Lord not been decreed, He would have certainly settled their differences (there and then). They were greatly suspicious and doubtful about the Book of Moses.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave the Book to Musa, but it has been differed about, and had not a word already gone forth from your Lord, judgment would certainly have been given between them; and most surely they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book, but differences were created concerning it: and had it not been for a word that had already gone forth from your Lord, the matter would have been decided between them; and certainly they are in grave doubt about it.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We certainly gave Moses the Book aforetime: but disputes arose therein. Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their differences) would have been settled between them: but they remained in suspicious disquieting doubt thereon.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Do you too, O believers, wish to question your Apostle as Moses was in the past? But he who takes unbelief in exchange for belief only strays from the right path.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Or do you desire to question your Messenger as Moses was questioned in former time? Whoso exchanges belief for unbelief has surely strayed from the right way.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Seek ye to question your apostle, even as Musa was questioned afore. And whosoever changeth belief for infidelity, he hath of a surety strayed from the even way.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Or do you want to ask your Messenger (Muhammad Peace be upon him) as Musa (Moses) was asked before (i.e. show us openly our Lord?) And he who changes Faith for disbelief, verily, he has gone astray from the right way.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Or do you want to question your Messenger as Moses was questioned before? Whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has strayed from the right path.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Would you then ask your Prophet such questions as were asked of Moses in former times? In fact, anyone, who changes the way of belief for that of disbelief, has surely swerved from the Right way.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Or do you want to ask your Messenger (Muhammad) as Musa (Moses) was asked before (i.e. show us openly our Lord) And he who changes faith for disbelief, verily, he has gone astray from the right way.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Or would ye question your messenger as Moses was questioned aforetime? He who chooseth disbelief instead of faith, verily he hath gone astray from a plain road.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Would you question your Apostle as Moses was questioned formerly? Whoever changes faith for unfaith certainly strays from the right way.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Would you rather demand of your Messenger that which was once demanded of Moses! He who exchanges belief for disbelief has surely strayed from the Right Path.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Or do you intend to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Do you want to address the Prophet in the same manner in which Moses was addressed? Anyone who exchanges belief for disbelief has certainly gone down the wrong path.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Rather you wish to put questions to your Apostle, as Musa was questioned before; and whoever adopts unbelief instead of faith, he indeed has lost the right direction of the way.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Do you [all] want to question your messenger just as Moses was questioned previously? Anyone who exchanges faith for unbelief has strayed from the right path.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Would ye question your Messenger as Moses was questioned of old? but whoever changeth from Faith to Unbelief, Hath strayed without doubt from the even way.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear proofs

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Thereafter We sent Musa and his brother Harun with Our signs and an authority manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We sent Musa (Moses) and his brother Harun (Aaron), with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and manifest authority,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our signs and a clear authority.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We sent Musa and his brother Harun, with Our Ayat and manifest authority,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our tokens and a clear warrant

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and Aaron, his brother, with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear authority

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then We sent Musa and his brother Haroun, with Our communications and a clear authority,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and clear authority

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: To Pharaoh and his nobles who behaved with arrogance, for they were a conceited lot,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: unto Pharaoh and his Council; but they waxed proud, and they were a lofty people,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Unto Fir'awn and his chiefs, but they grew stiff-necked, and they were a people self-exalting.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: To Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, but they behaved insolently and they were people self-exalting (by disobeying their Lord, and exalting themselves over and above the Messenger of Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: To Pharaoh and his nobles, but they turned arrogant. They were oppressive people.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: to Pharaoh and to his chiefs, but they behaved superciliously and they were haughty.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: To Fir`awn and his chiefs, but they behaved insolently and they were people self-exalting (by disobeying their Lord).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they scorned (them) and they were despotic folk.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his elites; but they acted arrogantly and they were a tyrannical lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his Council, but they were very proud, and they were a tyrannical nation.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: to the Pharaoh and his nobles. But they behaved proudly and thought themselves superior people.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: To Firon and his chiefs, but they behaved haughtily and they were an insolent people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his courtiers, but they behaved insolently, for they were an arrogant people.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: To Pharaoh and his Chiefs: But these behaved insolently: they were an arrogant people.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then they accused them of lies, and joined the company of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So they cried them lies, and they were among the destroyed.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then they belied the twain; so they became of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they denied them both [Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron)] and became of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So they called them liars, and thus were among those destroyed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So they rejected them, calling them liars, and they too eventually became of those that were destroyed.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So, they denied them both and became of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: So they denied them, and became of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So they impugned the two of them, whereat they were among those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: So they belied them, and they were among the destroyed.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They called them liars and consequently were destroyed.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So they rejected them and became of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So they rejected them both, and became those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So they accused them of falsehood, and they became of those who were destroyed.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And We gave the Book to Moses so that they may be guided.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, that haply they would be guided;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We vouchsafed unto Musa the Book, that haply they may be guided.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa (Moses) the Scripture, that they may be guided.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Scripture, that they may be guided.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book that people might be guided by it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We gave Musa the Scripture, that they may be guided.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, that haply they might go aright.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, in order that they might be guided.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses so that perhaps they may have guidance.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave Musa the Book that they may follow a right direction.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book, in order that they might receive guidance.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and full authority

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Moses with Our signs, and a manifest authority,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Musa with Our signs and a manifest warranty.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and a manifest authority;

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear mandate.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And indeed We sent Moses with Our signs and with a clear authority

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We sent Musa with Our Ayat and a manifest authority.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs and a manifest authority

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent Moses with Our signs and with clear authority

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Moses to the Pharaoh and his nobles with Our miracles and a clear authority.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Musa with Our communications and a clear authority,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent forth Moses with Our signs and with manifest authority,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And we sent Moses, with Our Clear (Signs) and an authority manifest,

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: To the Pharaoh and his nobles, but they followed the bidding of Pharaoh, though the bidding of Pharaoh was unrightful.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his Council; but they followed Pharaoh's command, and Pharaoh's command was not right-minded.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Unto Firawn and his chiefs. But they followed the commandment of Fir'awn, and the commandment of Fir'awn was not right- minded.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: To Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, but they followed the command of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), and the command of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) was no right guide.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: To Pharaoh and his nobles, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not wise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his nobles. But they obeyed the command of Pharaoh even though Pharaoh's command was not rightly-directed.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: To Fir`awn and his chiefs, but they followed the command of Fir`awn, and the command of Fir`awn was no right guide.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they did follow the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was no right guide.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his elite, but they followed Pharaoh’s dictates, and Pharaoh’s dictates were not right-minded.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his Council. But they followed the command of Pharaoh, and Pharaoh's command was not rightminded.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not [at all] discerning.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They followed the order of the Pharaoh but Pharaoh's orders were evil.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: To Firon and his chiefs, but they followed the bidding of Firon, and Firon's bidding was not right-directing.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: to Pharaoh and his nobles. But they followed the command of Pharaoh and the command of Pharaoh was not rightly directed.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs: but they followed the command of Pharaoh and the command of Pharaoh was no right (guide).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Like the people of the Pharaoh, and those before them, who rejected Our signs, and were punished for their sins by God; and the punishment of God is severe.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: like Pharaoh's folk, and the people before them, who cried lies to Our signs; God seized them because of their sins; God is terrible in retribution.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: After the wont of the people of Fir'awn and those before them. They belied Our signs, wherefore Allah laid hold of them for their sins. And Allah is Severe in chastising.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Like the behaviour of the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and those before them; they belied Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), so Allah seized (destroyed) them for their sins. And Allah is Severe in punishment.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Like the behavior of Pharaoh’s people and those before them. They rejected Our signs, so God seized them for their sins. God is Strict in retribution.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (To them shall happen) the like of what happened to the people of Pharaoh, and those before them. They rejected Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. Allah indeed is severe in punishment.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Like the behavior of the people of Fir`awn and those before them; they belied Our Ayat. So Allah punished them for their sins. And Allah is severe in punishment.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's folk and those who were before them, they disbelieved Our revelations and so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in punishment.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: as in the case of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who denied Our signs. So Allah seized them for their sins, and Allah is severe in retribution.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's people and those before them who belied Our revelations; Allah seized them in their sinfulness. Allah is firm in inflicting punishment.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They do as the people of Pharaoh and those who lived before them did. They called Our revelations mere lies. God punished them for their sins. God is stern in His retribution.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Like the striving of the people of Firon and those before them; they rejected Our communications, so Allah destroyed them on account of their faults; and Allah is severe in requiting (evil).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Their end will be like Pharaoh's people and those before them; they denied Our signs, so God seized them in their sinfulness: God is stern in punishment.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Their plight will be) no better than that of the people of Pharaoh, and their predecessors: They denied our Signs, and Allah called them to account for their sins. For Allah is strict in punishment.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Their case is like that of Pharaoh's people, and of those before them, who denied the revelations of God, and were punished for their sins by God, and God is all powerful and Severe His punishment.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's folk, and the people before him, who disbelieved in God's signs; God seized them because of their sins; God is strong, terrible in retribution.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Like are they unto the wont of the house of Fir'awn and those before them. They disbelieved in the signs of Allah, wherefore Allah laid hold of them for their sins. Verily Allah is strong, Severe in retribution.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Similar to the behaviour of the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), and of those before them; they rejected the Ayat (proofs, verses, etc.) of Allah, so Allah punished them for their sins. Verily, Allah is All-Strong, Severe in punishment.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Like the behavior of the people of Pharaoh, and those before them. They rejected the signs of God, so God seized them for their sins. God is Powerful, Severe in punishment.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Their case is like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied the signs of Allah and so Allah seized them for their sins. Surely Allah is All-Powerful, Stern in retribution.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Similar to the behavior of the people of Fir`awn, and of those before them -- they rejected the Ayat of Allah, so Allah punished them for their sins. Verily, Allah is All-Strong, severe in punishment.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Their way is) as the way of Pharaoh's folk and those before them; they disbelieved the revelations of Allah, and Allah took them in their sins. Lo! Allah is Strong, severe in punishment.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Like the precedent of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who defied Allah’s signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed Allah is all-strong, severe in retribution.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's family and those who have gone before them, they disbelieved the signs of Allah. Therefore, Allah seized them in their sinfulness. Mighty is Allah and stern in retribution.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They disbelieved in the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and severe in penalty.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The same thing happened to the people of Pharaoh and those who lived before them. They rejected the revelations of God and, because of their sins, His retribution struck them. God is All-powerful and stern in His retribution.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: In the manner of the people of Firon and those before them; they disbelieved in Allah's communications, therefore Allah destroyed them on account of their faults; surely Allah is strong, severe in requiting (evil).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's people and those that have gone before them, they rejected God's signs and God seized them for their sins. God is strong, and severe in punishment!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "(Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them: They rejected the Signs of Allah, and Allah punished them for their crimes: for Allah is Strong, and Strict in punishment:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: This was the case with the people of Pharaoh and those before them, who rejected the signs of their Lord and were destroyed for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh as they were oppressors.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Like Pharaoh's folk, and the people before him, who cried lies to the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them because of their sins, and We drowned the folk of Pharaoh; and all were evildoers.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Like are they Unto the wont of the house of Fir'awn and those before them. They belied the signs of their Lord; wherefore We destroyed them for their sins, and drowned the house of fir'awn; and all of them were wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Similar to the behaviour of the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh), and those before them. They belied the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) for they were all Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Such was the case with the people of Pharaoh, and those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We annihilated them for their wrongs, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh—they were all evildoers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Their case is like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them: they rejected the signs of their Lord as false and so We destroyed them for their sins, and caused the people of Pharaoh to drown. For they were wrong-doers all.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
